original: @45b # // rgya gar skad du /

translated: Praj√±ƒÅpradƒ´pa-m≈´lamadhyamakav·πõtti

original: bod skad du /

analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
translated: The Lamp of Wisdom, Commentary on the Root of the Middle Way

original: bam po dang po //
analyzed: bam po dang po //
translated: First chapter

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩslob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo // slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´!üîΩHomage to the noble master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna!

original: slob dpon btsun pa legs ldan 'byed la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: slob dpon btsun pa legs ldan 'byed la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the venerable master BhƒÅviveka!

original: gang gis chos kyi de nyid rnam rtog legs bral ba //
analyzed: gang gis chos kyi de nyid rnam rtog legs bral ba //
translated: He who is free from conceptualization of the thatness of phenomena,

original: spros pa kun zhi blo ngan rab rib kun 'joms can //
analyzed: spros pa kun zhi blo ngan rab rib kun 'joms can //
translated: Who has pacified all elaborations, who conquers the cataracts of the evil mind,

original: tshig gi yul ma yin yang de nyid sgro btags nas //
analyzed: tshig gi yul ma yin yang de nyid sgro btags nas //
translated: Though not an object of words, by superimposing thatness upon him,

original: sa kun 'byor phyir bstan pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sa kun 'byor phyir bstan pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to him, the teacher, for the sake of mastering all grounds.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi tshig le'ur byas pa dag kho nas rjes su dpag pa dang / sun dbyung ba'i gsal pa dang / de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal mod kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi tshig le'ur byas pa dag kho nas rjes su dpag pa dang / sun dbyung ba'i gsal pa dang / de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal mod kyi /
translated: The master's own verses alone are endowed with the clarity of inference and refutation, the teaching of reality, and the pacification of the net of bad views, and they proclaim the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams las kha cig gis mi rtogs pas /üîΩde'i phyir de dag gis rtogs par bya bar 'dod nas lung ji lta ba bzhin du @46a * //üîΩdbu ma'i bstan bcos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams las kha cig gis mi rtogs pas / de'i phyir de dag gis rtogs par bya bar 'dod nas lung ji lta ba bzhin du @46a * // dbu ma'i bstan bcos bshad par bya'o //
translated: However, some of the practitioners of pure conduct do not understand them.üîΩTherefore, desiring to make them understand, I will explain the treatise on the middle way just as it is.

original: de la bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa smras pa /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa smras pa /
translated: With regard to that, I will explain the commentary on the treatise.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros mnga' ba /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros mnga' ba /
translated: Here, the Blessed One, endowed with supreme compassion, has a mind that generates great enthusiasm.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med par /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med par /
translated: For countless hundreds of thousands of millions of eons,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa'i khur bzhes par mdzad pa na gzhan la phan pa skye ba dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i thugs rang gi srog dang 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang yongs su mi skyo ba mnga' bas 'jig rten skye ba dang /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gzhal du med pa'i khur bzhes par mdzad pa na gzhan la phan pa skye ba dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i thugs rang gi srog dang 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang yongs su mi skyo ba mnga' bas 'jig rten skye ba dang /
translated: When he took up the burden of gathering immeasurable merit and wisdom, he was not at all discouraged by the suffering of giving rise to benefit for others and by the suffering of losing his own life.

original: 'gag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / tha dad pa dang / gcig pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba thibs por 'khyams shing snang ba med pa la gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / tha dad pa dang / gcig pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba thibs por 'khyams shing snang ba med pa la gzigs nas /
translated: He saw that the world wanders in the thick net of conceptual elaborations, such as arising and ceasing, being annihilated and being permanent, coming and going, being different and being the same, and so on, and that it is without appearance.

original: shes rab kyis shes bya'i rgya mtsho mngon par bsrubs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis shes bya'i rgya mtsho mngon par bsrubs te /
translated: He churned the ocean of objects of knowledge with wisdom.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i bdud rtsi spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang legs par bral ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i bdud rtsi spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang legs par bral ba /
translated: He obtained the nectar of the thatness of all phenomena, which is completely free from the net of conceptual elaborations,

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa /
translated: which is not dependent on others,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa brnyes nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa brnyes nas /
translated: and which is nonconceptual.

original: theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rin po che dam pa skye ba dang na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus las 'da' ba med pa /
analyzed: theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rin po che dam pa skye ba dang na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus las 'da' ba med pa /
translated: For those who proceed by the supreme vehicle, the precious jewel of dependent origination is born without transcending birth, age, family, country, or time.

original: mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: It is not shared in common with any tƒ´rthikas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, or pratyekabuddhas.

original: skye ba dang skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: skye ba dang skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis bka' stsal to //
translated: Based on the conventional and ultimate truths, the Buddha taught it using expressions such as ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúnonarising.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rab tu bstan pa ma nor bar de bzhin nyid thugs su chud nas dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rab tu bstan pa ma nor bar de bzhin nyid thugs su chud nas dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, having realized the unerring suchness of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs way using words such as ‚Äúnonarising,‚Äù perfectly generated the powerful joy of understanding.

original: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /
analyzed: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /
translated: In accordance with his understanding, he praises the Bhagavat.

original: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas /
translated: Wishing to compose a treatise,üîΩhe first praises the Bhagavat.

original: thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas skye bo rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin cing khong du chud par 'dod pas rtogs par bzhed nas /
analyzed: thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas skye bo rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin cing khong du chud par 'dod pas rtogs par bzhed nas /
translated: Since he has a mind moistened by the water of compassion, he is intent on inferring beings and wishes to make them understand, so he is willing to teach.

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //üîΩ'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung // 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: He who taught dependent originationüîΩas free from cessation, free from production,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: free from annihilation, free from permanence,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
translated: free from coming, free from going,

original: tha dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: tha dad don min don gcig min //
translated: not a single thing, not a multiple thing,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
translated: the pacification of conceptual elaborations, the pacification of appearance,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //
translated: to the perfect Buddha, the best of speakers,

original: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: I pay homage.

original: @46b gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgra spyi yin yang 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kho na dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: @46b gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgra spyi yin yang 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kho na dang sbyar ro //
translated: Although ‚Äúhe who‚Äù is a verbal generality, since he wishes to teach dependent origination endowed with uncommon attributes, he is to be connected only with the Bhagavat.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The expression ‚Äúarising in dependence‚Äù is used because

original: khyad par bstan kyang khyad par gyi gzhi'i ming ma bstan na de mi rtogs pas de bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bstan kyang khyad par gyi gzhi'i ming ma bstan na de mi rtogs pas de bstan pa yin no //
translated: if a specific characteristic is taught without teaching the name of the basis of the specific characteristic, it is not understood.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression ‚Äúarising in dependence‚Äù is used because

original: kha cig na re rten cing zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni zlos pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel par zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re rten cing zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni zlos pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel par zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: some say that the prefix pratƒ´ means ‚Äúrepeatedly,‚Äù sa·πÉ means ‚Äúto meet,‚Äù and utpƒÅda means ‚Äúto arise,‚Äù so that pratƒ´tyasamutpƒÅda means ‚Äúarising repeatedly by meeting and arising.‚Äù

original: de dang de la rten cing phrad nas 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de dang de la rten cing phrad nas 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
translated: That is, it arises by meeting and depending on this and that.

original: gzhan dag na re so so 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re so so 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the arising of those that possess individual cessation is pratƒ´tyasamutpƒÅda.

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni de yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not correct that it is not different from that.

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa 'di la don gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa 'di la don gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the statement ‚ÄúThe visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,‚Äù neither of the two meanings is present.

original: 'o na gang yin zhe na /üîΩ'di yod na 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba rkyen 'di dang ldan pa nyid kyi don ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang yin zhe na / 'di yod na 'di 'byung la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba rkyen 'di dang ldan pa nyid kyi don ni /
translated: What is the meaning of dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of ‚Äúwhen this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises,‚Äù which is the meaning of ‚Äúbeing endowed with conditions.‚Äù

original: 'dir kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re /
translated: Here, a certain person says:

original: gal te 'byung ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu rkyen dang phrad nas phyis 'byung na ni de'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu rkyen dang phrad nas phyis 'byung na ni de'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the effect were to come into contact with conditions prior to its arising and then arise later, it would be called ‚Äúdependently arisen.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu rkyen dang mi 'phrad de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu rkyen dang mi 'phrad de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the effect does not come into contact with conditions prior to its arising because it does not exist.

original: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore the term ‚Äúdependently arisen‚Äù is not established.

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par zhes bya ba dang / 'byung zhes bya ba gnyis dus gcig tu khas len pas nyes pa med do zhe na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra la bya ba gnyis dus gcig na med de /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par zhes bya ba dang / 'byung zhes bya ba gnyis dus gcig tu khas len pas nyes pa med do zhe na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra la bya ba gnyis dus gcig na med de /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because you accept that the words ‚Äúdependently arisen‚Äù and ‚Äúarisen‚Äù are used at the same time, then the word ‚Äúdependently arisen‚Äù would not have two actions at the same time.

original: par zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na khru byas te bza' zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: par zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na khru byas te bza' zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúhaving measured, eat‚Äù are used at the same time.

original: byed pa po med par yang gzhi med pa'i bya ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: byed pa po med par yang gzhi med pa'i bya ba mi rung ste /
translated: And if there is no agent, it is not tenable that there is an action without a basis.

original: med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba bzhin no /üîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba bzhin no / zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, the son of a barren woman does not go because he does not exist.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: 'bras bu med pa 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba khas len na ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that an action that has the characteristic of arising without a result exists,

original: rang la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not established for you.

original: yod pa las 'byung ba'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa las 'byung ba'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if you accept that it arises from an existent, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù is not established.

original: byed pa po gcig dang ldan pa'i bya ba gnyis dus gcig na yang yod de /üîΩpar @47a * //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig dang ldan pa'i bya ba gnyis dus gcig na yang yod de /üîΩpar @47a * //
translated: Two actions that possess a single agent exist at the same time.üîΩFor example, the words ‚Äúhaving measured, eat‚Äù are used at the same time.

original: zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na kha gdangs te nyal zhes bya ba dang / lam khyab par byas te 'gro'o zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na kha gdangs te nyal zhes bya ba dang / lam khyab par byas te 'gro'o zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúsleep with your mouth open‚Äù and ‚Äúgo along the road that has been traversed.‚Äù

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not definite.

original: byed pa po yod pa dang med pa la yang ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po yod pa dang med pa la yang ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if the existent and nonexistent agent are as stated, the error arises.

original: gzhan la yang grags pa'i gtan tshigs brjod na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang grags pa'i gtan tshigs brjod na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one states a reason that is accepted by others, there is an absurd consequence.

original: de bstan pa ni las yin te /üîΩ'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni las yin te / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: The teaching of that is the action.üîΩIt is without cessation and without arising,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: without annihilation and without permanence,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
translated: without coming and without going,

original: tha dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: tha dad don min don gcig min //
translated: not a different object and not the same object.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de la tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs pas de'i phyir dang po kho nar tshig gi don brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs pas de'i phyir dang po kho nar tshig gi don brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since one does not understand the meaning of a statement without understanding the meaning of the words, and one does not understand the meaning of a treatise without understanding the meaning of the statements and the chapters, therefore one should state the meaning of the words first of all.

original: kha cig na re tshig la sogs pa'i don rnams ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan pa byed pa nyid yin gyi tshig gi phyogs gcig ni lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: kha cig na re tshig la sogs pa'i don rnams ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan pa byed pa nyid yin gyi tshig gi phyogs gcig ni lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhes so //
translated: Some say: The meanings of the words, etc., are helpful to the meanings of the speech, etc., just as a part of the word is helpful to one who is traveling on a path.

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni tshig la sogs pa ni 'du byed bskyed pas bstan bcos kyi don yan lag ma lus pa khong du chud pa la phan pa byed pa nyid du rigs kyi sngar brtags pa ni mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni tshig la sogs pa ni 'du byed bskyed pas bstan bcos kyi don yan lag ma lus pa khong du chud pa la phan pa byed pa nyid du rigs kyi sngar brtags pa ni mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The words, etc., are not different because they are taught as being creators of formations. It is reasonable that they are helpful for understanding all the parts of the meaning of the treatise, but it is unreasonable to investigate them as before.

original: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: Cessation means destruction.

original: skye zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising means origination.

original: chad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Annihilation means the interruption of continuity.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'o //
translated: Permanence means enduring at all times.

original: 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni tshur 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni tshur 'ong ba'o //
translated: Coming means coming here.

original: 'gro zhes bya ba ni phar 'gro ba'o //üîΩtha dad ces bya ba ni don tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya ba ni phar 'gro ba'o // tha dad ces bya ba ni don tha dad pa'o //
translated: Going means going there.üîΩDifferent means different objects.

original: don gcig ces bya ba ni don tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: don gcig ces bya ba ni don tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Same object means not different objects.

original: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is not other.

original: de la 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnon-cessation‚Äù means that there is no cessation here.

original: don gcig min zhes bya ba'i bar du yang 'di la yang don gcig pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don gcig min zhes bya ba'i bar du yang 'di la yang don gcig pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúnot the same‚Äù means that there is no sameness here.

original: de la kha cig na re 'gag pa dang skye ba dang tha dad pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid bkag pa ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re 'gag pa dang skye ba dang tha dad pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid bkag pa ni don dam par ro //
translated: Here, some say that the negation of difference and sameness is in terms of the ultimate.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa bkag pa ni tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa bkag pa ni tha snyad du'o //
translated: The negation of annihilation and permanence is in terms of conventional usage.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bkag pa ni gnyi gar ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bkag pa ni gnyi gar ro zhe'o //
translated: The negation of going and coming is in both.

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni 'dir thams cad don dam par bkag ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni 'dir thams cad don dam par bkag ste /
translated: Here, non-otherness is negated in terms of the ultimate.

original: nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is specified.

original: gzhan du yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory elsewhere.

original: khyad par gyi gzhi'i khyad par ji skad bstan pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad pa pos bstan pa nyid kyis bzhed pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi'i khyad par ji skad bstan pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad pa pos bstan pa nyid kyis bzhed pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the particular of the basis of the distinction as taught, and because the supreme intention is by the teacher himself.

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid mngon par zhen @47b pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //üîΩzhi zhes bya ba ni gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid mngon par zhen @47b pa zhi ba'i phyir ro // zhi zhes bya ba ni gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The phrase the pacification of all mental elaborations means the pacification of the adherence to the nature of verbal expression.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word peace means freedom from all injury or it means empty of intrinsic reality.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa'o //üîΩrdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa'o // rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The word taught means spoken.

original: chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word perfect buddha means the Blessed One, because he has realized the selflessness of both persons and phenomena in a manner that is true and nonerroneous.

original: smra rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: smra rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
translated: The word speakers means the speakers who are the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches the unerring dependent origination, it teaches the path that leads to the attainment of heaven and liberation.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog ste ;
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog ste ;
translated: The word ‚Äúexcellent‚Äù means ‚Äúsupreme.‚Äù

original: ji skad smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the dependent origination that possesses the unerring distinctions mentioned above that is taught.

original: de'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni 'dud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni 'dud par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚ÄúI pay homage to it‚Äù means ‚ÄúI bow to it.‚Äù

original: 'dir kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung na ni ji ltar skye ba med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung na ni ji ltar skye ba med pa yin /
translated: If it is dependent origination, how can it be non-arisen?

original: ji ste skye ba med na ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes byar yang mi rung bas rang gi tshig dang 'gal zhing dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste skye ba med na ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung zhes byar yang mi rung bas rang gi tshig dang 'gal zhing dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is non-arisen, it is not suitable to call it ‚Äúdependent origination.‚Äù Therefore, you contradict your own words and incur the fault of your thesis,

original: de nyid kyis de'i don la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de'i don la skur ba btab pa'i phyir /
translated: because you have thereby repudiated its meaning.

original: dper na smras pa thams cad brdzun pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na smras pa thams cad brdzun pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúall speech is false.‚Äù

original: de la gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de la gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If you assert that all dependent origination is non-arisen, then that error would ensue.

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas ma blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas ma blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas /
translated: But since the term all includes the conventional dependent origination that is not accepted, and since you accept that ultimate dependent origination exists,

original: de la skur ba gdab pa ma byas pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la skur ba gdab pa ma byas pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: you do not commit the error of denying it. Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor ba sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang ;
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor ba sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang ;
translated: For example, though generosity and so on are not virtuous ultimately, they are called virtuous in the context of the accumulation of samsaric virtue, and though consciousness is accepted as the self, the thesis that consciousness is not the self ultimately does not commit the error of a thesis.

original: dper na sprul pa'i skyes bu skye ba la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid du skye ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sprul pa'i skyes bu skye ba la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid du skye ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a magical person is born without the reality of a person being born,

original: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu'i nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid skye ba yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu'i nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid skye ba yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: so also the birth of the internal sense spheres, which are like illusions and mirages, is conventional, not ultimate.

original: gzhan dag na re skye ba'i 'og tu 'gag pa dgag par rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skye ba'i 'og tu 'gag pa dgag par rigs te /
translated: Others say that it is reasonable to refute cessation after birth,

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @48a * //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @48a * //
translated: because it is preceded by birth,

original: phyir chad pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyir chad pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like a cut.

original: 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'i phyir 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi skye ba yang phyis dgag par khas ma blangs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'i phyir 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi skye ba yang phyis dgag par khas ma blangs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since samsara has no beginning, we do not accept that birth, which is preceded by cessation, exists later. Therefore the error of the reason being indefinite arises.

original: 'gag pa ni skye ba'i rim pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skye ba'i rim pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: and because the consequence is the same if the words are rearranged, there is no fault.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa dag na re /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa dag na re /
translated: Some of our own schools, who do not wish to compose treatises, say:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Since dependent origination that possesses the attributes of nonarising and so on is unconditioned, it is established for us as well. Therefore dependent origination

original: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: is not unique to the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore it is not logical to compose a treatise.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special quality of dependent origination, namely, its non-arising, is taught by the method of negation, and there is no inference to show that dependent origination exists as unconditioned.

original: rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that the arising from a specific condition is itself unconditioned, then it is impossible for it to be the reality of that, because arising is negated.

original: skye ba ni 'dus ma byas min te /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'dus ma byas min te /
translated: Arising is not unconditioned,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: because it has a cause, like endurance.

original: rjes su dpag pa las de med pas mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las de med pas mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not exist by inference, it is not reasonable.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las gzhan dag 'di skad ces skye ba med pa ni de las gzhan skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las gzhan dag 'di skad ces skye ba med pa ni de las gzhan skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others, who are not of our own Buddhist school, say that non-arising is not that, because it does not arise from another,

original: dbang phyug ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'gag pa med pa ni mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa ni mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-cessation is because there is no non-cessation imagined by the tƒ´rthikas,

original: bdag med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa bzhin no //
translated: like selflessness.

original: chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa ni rgyu la brten te 'bras bu skye zhing /
analyzed: chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa ni rgyu la brten te 'bras bu skye zhing /
translated: Non-annihilation and non-eternality are because the effect arises in dependence on the cause,

original: 'bras bu skye ba na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and when the effect arises, the cause ceases.

original: 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa ni skyes pa'i yul nyid du 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa ni skyes pa'i yul nyid du 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-coming and non-going are because it perishes in the very place where it arises.

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-difference in meaning and non-identity in meaning are because it cannot be said to be either the same or different,

original: nor bu'am bud shing ngam nyi ma dang phrad pa las byung ba'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu'am bud shing ngam nyi ma dang phrad pa las byung ba'i me bzhin no //
translated: like fire arising from contact with a magnifying glass, fuel, or the sun.

original: de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gsung rab kyi tshul yin pas nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gsung rab kyi tshul yin pas nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Since such dependent origination is the method of the scriptures, it is not exclusive to the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mi dgos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mi dgos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to compose a treatise.

original: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar ston pas /
analyzed: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar ston pas /
translated: Since it teaches that arising itself is just the nature of non-arising,

original: rten cing @48b 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing @48b 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: it accepts dependent origination as possessing the attributes of non-arising and so on.

original: de ni khyad par shin tu che bas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mi dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni khyad par shin tu che bas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mi dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is a very great distinction, it is not the case that the treatise is unnecessary.

original: slob dpon gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de kho na ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de kho na ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas /
translated: The master, by teaching just that dependent origination possessing the uncommon attributes of non-arising and so on, praises the Bhagavat.

original: skye ba med pa bstan nas 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par bstan sla bar dgongs pa na skye ba med pa dang por bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: skye ba med pa bstan nas 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par bstan sla bar dgongs pa na skye ba med pa dang por bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Thinking that after teaching non-arising, it is easy to teach the attributes of non-ceasing and so on, he wishes to teach non-arising first.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du mdzad do /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du mdzad do /
translated: He directly perceives the conceptions that are the ascriptive and descriptive designations imputed by others.

original: 'di ltar skye bar smra ba dag las kha cig ni dngos po rnams bdag las skye'o zhes zer /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bar smra ba dag las kha cig ni dngos po rnams bdag las skye'o zhes zer /
translated: In this way, some of those who advocate arising say that things arise from themselves.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan las so zhes zer /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan las so zhes zer /
translated: Others say that things arise from another.

original: kha cig ni gnyis las so zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig ni gnyis las so zhes zer /
translated: Some say that things arise from both.üîΩOthers say that things arise without a cause.üîΩWhen they are examined by means of reasoning and scripture, they are unable to tolerate the analysis.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyu med pa las so zhes zer ba dag rigs pa dang lung dag gis brtags pa na skye ba rnam pa thams cad du 'thad pa mi bzod par rang la nges pa'i dbang gis ;
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyu med pa las so zhes zer ba dag rigs pa dang lung dag gis brtags pa na skye ba rnam pa thams cad du 'thad pa mi bzod par rang la nges pa'i dbang gis ;
translated: They are forced to accept that arising is untenable in any way.üîΩThey say:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Things do not arise from themselves, nor do they arise from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
translated: nor do they arise from both, nor do they arise without a cause.

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Things that exist in any way

original: skyes ba nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes ba nam yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: never arise.

original: 'di ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa yin no //
translated: This is the general statement of the thesis.

original: de la re zhig bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
translated: Now, what is meant by ‚ÄúThings do not arise from themselves‚Äù?üîΩThings that exist in any way

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: never arise.

original: re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to each of the four theses.

original: bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom itself‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom its own self.‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis bsams pa'i tshig gi don mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis bsams pa'i tshig gi don mi 'grub pas /
translated: The meaning of a statement is not established by mere assertion.

original: 'dir phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa nyid yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa nyid yin par gzung ste /
translated: Here, the property of the position is taken to be existence.

original: 'di ltar bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yod pa la snyad gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yod pa la snyad gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúfrom itself‚Äù is a restatement of ‚Äúits own existence.‚Äù

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos grags pa dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos grags pa dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example is in terms of the property of the probandum and the property of the proof, because the example is a subject that possesses the property of the probandum and the property of the proof.

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du lta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du lta bar bya ste /
translated: This negation ‚Äúnot from itself‚Äù should be viewed as having the meaning of a nonimplicative negation.

original: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtogs pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya'i yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtogs pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya'i yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the negation is primary and because it is intended that the establishment of nonconceptual wisdom, which possesses all objects of knowledge as its object, is by the negation of the entire net of conceptualization.

original: ma yin pa dgag pa yongs su bzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba @49a * //
analyzed: ma yin pa dgag pa yongs su bzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba @49a * //
translated: If you accept an implicative negation, then since that is a primary affirmation, the statement ‚ÄúThings are not produced‚Äù is an affirmation, and thus it would not teach non-production.

original: med pa ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Hence, it would be devoid of purpose.üîΩA sutra states:

original: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you engage in the non-production of form, you do not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, you should ascertain that things are definitely not produced from themselves.

original: gzhan du nges par gzung na bdag kho na las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan du nges par gzung na bdag kho na las skye ba med de /
translated: If you ascertain anything else, you would ascertain that things are not produced only from themselves.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩbdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / bdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
translated: What then?

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: You would ascertain that they are produced from both self and other, but that is not accepted because it is devoid of purpose.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
translated: Here, the syllogism is:

original: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //üîΩgal te gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no // gal te gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense-spheres do not arise from themselves, because they exist, like consciousness, which exists.

original: gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason ‚Äúbecause they exist‚Äù is not a valid reason, because it has not been shown that it is the opposite of the discordant side,üîΩthen we reply that it is not a valid reason, because it is the opposite of the discordant side.

original: med pa kho na'i phyir de la ldog pa med pas 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: med pa kho na'i phyir de la ldog pa med pas 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it is nonexistent, it has no opposite. Therefore, there is no fault in this or in any other syllogism.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de ;
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de ;
translated: Here, some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas respond:

original: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin /üîΩci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
analyzed: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin / ci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
translated: What is the meaning of the thesis?üîΩDoes ‚Äúfrom itself‚Äù mean from the essence of the effect?

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las des cir 'gyur /
translated: Or does it mean from the essence of the cause? What follows from that?

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa bsgrub bo //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa bsgrub bo //
translated: If it means from the essence of the effect, then what is established is being proven.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: If it means from the essence of the cause, then there is a contradiction in the meaning.

original: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because all that is produced is produced only from that which exists in the nature of a cause.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: bdag las skye ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag las skye ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we are refuting production from self alone.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye bsel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye bsel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because production from that which is in the nature of a cause is also refuted as production from self and other.

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do //
translated: And because the existence of consciousness is accepted as having the characteristic of potentiality, there is no fault.

original: 'di las gzhan ni dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan ni dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
translated: Apart from this, things are not produced from their own nature,

original: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do //
translated: because their production would be pointless and because there would be an infinite regress of production.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,üîΩbecause it is not established.

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal pa'i phyir dang / glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal pa'i phyir dang / glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not state a reason and an example, because it does not remove the faults stated by the other party, and because it is a statement that can be turned around.

original: skabs kyi don las bzlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i chos bzlog pa'i don mngon pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba thug pa yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdzad @49b pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi don las bzlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i chos bzlog pa'i don mngon pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba thug pa yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdzad @49b pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it contradicts the conclusion of the treatise, since the meaning of the probandum and its property are reversed in the context, the meaning of the reversal is directly stated, and things would arise from other, arising would have a result, and arising would have an end.

original: gzhan dag na re dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Others say that it is not correct to say that things do not arise from themselves.

original: phyogs snga ma rang dgar sbyar ba la sel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma rang dgar sbyar ba la sel ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it refutes the prior position that is applied at will.

original: ri bong gi rva las 'jig rten gsum skye ba sel ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva las 'jig rten gsum skye ba sel ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like refuting the arising of the three worlds from a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: nus pa dang gsal ba ni bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: nus pa dang gsal ba ni bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
translated: Since potency and manifestation are not different from themselves, like the self of a self,

original: de las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba zhes bya ba yin pas phyogs snga ma grub bo //
analyzed: de las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba zhes bya ba yin pas phyogs snga ma grub bo //
translated: arising from them is called arising from self. Thus the opponent‚Äôs position is established.

original: phyogs rnams rnam par brtags su zin na yang mi rigs pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir de yongs su bzung bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs rnams rnam par brtags su zin na yang mi rigs pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir de yongs su bzung bas nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though the positions have been analyzed, there is no fault in accepting them, because it is necessary to state what is unreasonable.

original: de ltar na re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, first, things do not arise from self.

original: gzhan las min zhes bya ba yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan las min zhes bya ba yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúnot from another‚Äù?

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: Nor do they arise from another.üîΩThings do not arise from other things.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni pha rol las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni pha rol las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù means from something other than itself.

original: dgag pa'i don rgyas pa dang bcas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i don rgyas pa dang bcas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the negation and the elaboration are as before.

original: 'dir yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid chos nyid yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid chos nyid yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no //
translated: Here, the property of the position is clearly manifest, because the nature of another is a property.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so //
translated: The example is given by the word ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
translated: Here is the syllogism: Ultimately, the internal sense-spheres do not arise from other conditions,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te /
translated: Or, ultimately, the conditions that are asserted to be other, such as the eye, are not the producers of the internal sense-spheres, such as the eye, because they are other.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the materials such as thread.

original: ji ste gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /üîΩdam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag ste /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste / dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag ste /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause they are other‚Äù is not a correct reason,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis, for example, like ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is sound,‚Äù

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: then that is not good.

original: snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: The sound of poetry is impermanentüîΩbecause it is sound.

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshig nyid du grub pa mthong bas gtan tshigs ma nyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshig nyid du grub pa mthong bas gtan tshigs ma nyes pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the proposition is established as the reason itself, as in the example because it is sound, like the sound of a great drum. Therefore, the reason is not faulty.

original: bye brag dag las gzhan rdul phra rab kho na las rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag gis phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: bye brag dag las gzhan rdul phra rab kho na las rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag gis phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Those who assert that the subtle particles themselves, other than the distinctions, gradually produce the substances with parts, such as the earth, water, fire, and wind particles, refute this by saying, Because they are other, and so on.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don yon tan yin par rtog na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don yon tan yin par rtog na ni /
translated: If the meaning of the reason is conceived to be a quality,

original: don rang la ma grub pa nyid do //üîΩde las gzhan pa'i don yin par rtog na ni grags @50a * //
analyzed: don rang la ma grub pa nyid do // de las gzhan pa'i don yin par rtog na ni grags @50a * //
translated: then the meaning is not established for oneself.üîΩIf it is conceived to be a meaning other than that,

original: pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: then it would be undermined by what is well-known.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu spyi bo'i chos grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu spyi bo'i chos grub pa kho na ste /
translated: because the cause of another's understanding is established as a property of the subject.

original: gtan tshigs nyid spyir brjod pa'i phyir dang / de yon tan nyid dam gzhan nyid yin par sems pa yang sems pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid spyir brjod pa'i phyir dang / de yon tan nyid dam gzhan nyid yin par sems pa yang sems pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason itself is stated in general terms, and because the thought that it is a quality or something else is a different thought.

original: grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is there the fault of contradicting what is commonly held,

original: dam bcas pa khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thesis is qualified.

original: don dam par sa'i rdul phra rab dag sa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sa'i rdul phra rab dag sa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, the subtle particles of earth do not form the substance called earth,

original: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no //
translated: because they are subtle particles, like the subtle particles of fire.

original: de bzhin du me'i rdul phra rab dag kyang me'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i rdul phra rab dag kyang me'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the subtle particles of fire do not form the substance of fire, and so on.

original: chos mngon pa la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: chos mngon pa la gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say in the Abhidharma

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba gal te 'bras bu'i nus pas stong pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba gal te 'bras bu'i nus pas stong pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: that if difference is taken to be the emptiness of the effect‚Äôs potential, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gal te des mi stong pa nyid la bya na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te des mi stong pa nyid la bya na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If it is taken to mean not empty, then the example does not have the property to be established.

original: gzhi gzhan la ltos pa gzhan nyid kyi blo bskyed pa spyi'i chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi gzhan la ltos pa gzhan nyid kyi blo bskyed pa spyi'i chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The example is a general statement about a general property, namely, the production of the idea of difference in dependence on different bases.

original: ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba dang / sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba dang / sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: This reductio is like an unestablished reason and like an unestablished example.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The subject is not established because ultimately you do not accept external and internal sense bases, and so the error of nonestablishment of the subject occurs in your reductio.

original: tha snyad du de'i gzhi bum pa dang mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad du de'i gzhi bum pa dang mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since conventionally you accept the bases of those, such as eyes and pots, and their difference, the error you ascribe to us is not tenable. Therefore your argument is not correct.

original: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams gzhan las kyang skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams gzhan las kyang skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Here, the other party explains that things do not arise from other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
translated: Because it follows that everything would arise from everything.

original: des na de la glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa byas na dngos po rnams bdag gam gnyis sam rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de la glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa byas na dngos po rnams bdag gam gnyis sam rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since this is a statement that can be refuted, when the probandum and the proof are reversed, it contradicts the prior position because things would arise from self, both, or causelessly, and because something would arise from something.

original: gzhan du na yang thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba gnyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba gnyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it follows that everything would arise from everything, since there is neither proof nor refutation of that,

original: de ni don 'brel ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni don 'brel ba med pa yin te /
translated: it is meaningless.üîΩFor example, it is like saying:

original: dper na / gla sgang slo tres sgyu rur dag rims la phan //
analyzed: dper na / gla sgang slo tres sgyu rur dag rims la phan //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sweet and sour fruits are helpful for the fever of leprosy.‚Äù

original: smad 'tshong rnams la snying du sdug pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: smad 'tshong rnams la snying du sdug pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: There is no one who loves prostitutes.

original: smyig @50b pa'i skyig ma mde'u dag ni lci zhing kha bag yod //
analyzed: smyig @50b pa'i skyig ma mde'u dag ni lci zhing kha bag yod //
translated: The bamboo‚Äôs joints are hard and prickly.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer dag ni tsha ba'i dus na bsil //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer dag ni tsha ba'i dus na bsil //
translated: The moon‚Äôs rays are cool in the hot season.

original: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: This is how it is.

original: des na de ltar dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med do //
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, things do not arise from other.

original: grangs can dag ni byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye bas sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing gnyis las skye bar sems pas de'i phyir de dag la gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bka' stsal te /üîΩbdag dang gzhan gnyis las ma yin //
analyzed: grangs can dag ni byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye bas sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing gnyis las skye bar sems pas de'i phyir de dag la gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bka' stsal te / bdag dang gzhan gnyis las ma yin //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the effect, the sprout, arises from the seed, which has the nature of earth and so on, both in its differentiated and its undifferentiated states. Since they think that it arises from both, therefore this statement is made to them: ‚ÄúIt does not arise from both.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that it does not arise from both self and other.

original: dgag pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the negation is as before.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang ;
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang ;
translated: No thing arises from any other thing.

original: / skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: / skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Never is there a birth of an existent.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khungs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar yang dgongs so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khungs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar yang dgongs so //
translated: Because the argument is inconclusive due to the two-sided argument, and because there is no inference to show that things are born from both.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: gcer bur rgyu ba pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: gcer bur rgyu ba pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir yang /
translated: In order to refute the position of the Nirgranthas, he said,

original: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di bka' stsal te /
translated: ‚ÄúNor without a cause,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni gser gyi sor gdub ni gser dang / me la sogs pa las bdag dang gzhan las skye bar smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni gser gyi sor gdub ni gser dang / me la sogs pa las bdag dang gzhan las skye bar smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For they say that a golden bracelet is born from gold, and from fire, etc.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnyis las ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnyis las ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not from both.

original: da ni rgyu med min zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyu med min zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, he should say, ‚ÄúNor without a cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúwithout a cause.‚Äù

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: ‚ÄúNo entity whatsoever

original: skyes pa na ma yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa na ma yang yod ma yin //
translated: and when it is born, the mother does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is because there is no inference to support that view, and because there is the fault of contradicting both inference and what is commonly acknowledged.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: As for the fault of contradicting inference, things that are internal sense bases, which are accepted conventionally, are not born without a cause.

original: spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they have universals and particulars.

original: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a sprout.

original: grags pa'i gnod pa ni 'jig rten 'di na yod pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu las skye bar grags te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa ni 'jig rten 'di na yod pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu las skye bar grags te /
translated: As for the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged, whatever exists in this world is commonly acknowledged to be born from a cause.

original: dper na rgyu spun dag las snam bu dang / rtsi rkyang dag las sa ba ma skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun dag las snam bu dang / rtsi rkyang dag las sa ba ma skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a cloth from threads as its cause, or a pot from clay.

original: yang na rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu ngan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu ngan pa ste /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúwithout a cause‚Äù means a bad cause.

original: chung ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chung ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the expression ‚Äúwithout a wife.‚Äù

original: rgyu ngan pa gang zhe na /üîΩngo bo nyid dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med @51a * //
analyzed: rgyu ngan pa gang zhe na / ngo bo nyid dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med @51a * //
translated: What is a bad cause?

original: kyi bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kyi bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is a cause that is non-existent by nature, or that is God, or a primordial being, or primordial nature, or time, or atoms, or chance, or inherent in things themselves.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a good cause because it is not a real cause.

original: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa de las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa de las skye ba med de /
translated: Things do not arise without a cause,

original: de las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde la re zhig ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: de las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so // de la re zhig ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag na re /
translated: because there is no inference to prove that they arise in that way, and because such a doctrine is contradicted by inference.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bca' ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bca' ste /
translated: The proponents of a nature cause maintain that the internal sense spheres arise from a nature.

original: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir dper na padma dag gi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa lta bu dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang /üîΩaan da rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir dper na padma dag gi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa lta bu dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aan da rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la /
translated: And the necks of peacocks are the color of sapphire and great lapis lazuli.

original: mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And the eyes in their tailfeathers are colorful and brilliant.

original: des na de la dam bcas pa'i don de gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir ;
analyzed: des na de la dam bcas pa'i don de gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, if the meaning of your thesis is in terms of the relative, then the internal sense bases, which are the objects of relative consciousness, are not the effects of an independent agent, because they are not created by anyone at all.

original: rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub bo //
analyzed: rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub bo //
translated: If they arise from the determination of conditions, then you are proving what is already established.

original: ji ste don dam par na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: ji ste don dam par na ni dpe med de /
translated: If the meaning of your thesis is in terms of the ultimate, then there is no example.
