original: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately, we do not accept that a lotus and so on arises.

original: rgyu med par smra ba dag kho bo'i phyogs ni thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod la /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba dag kho bo'i phyogs ni thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod la /
translated: The nihilists say, ‚ÄúWe accept that everything is established without cause.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo //
translated: If you accept that the probandum is established by the reason, then you contradict your own position.‚Äù

original: ji ste rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is impossible to teach the nonexistence of a reason to those who accept the existence of a cause, just as it is impossible to teach the language of barbarians to barbarians,‚Äù

original: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhe na /
translated: then, although you apply a reason, you cannot avoid the refutation of the opponent.

original: skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas rtags can gyi don ston pa'i phyir dper na kla grol phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa de la rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs tha dad pa bzhin pas de
analyzed: skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas rtags can gyi don ston pa'i phyir dper na kla grol phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa de la rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs tha dad pa bzhin pas de
translated: Even if you translate into another language, you can teach the meaning of the probandum only by means of the reason that is understood. For example, it is like this: when a barbarian teaches that fire exists because of smoke, he uses a different method to generate understanding of the reason.

original: ni lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ni lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, that is not a suitable response.

original: 'jug stobs can dag na re mer mer po dag dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la bum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas /
analyzed: 'jug stobs can dag na re mer mer po dag dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la bum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas /
translated: The powerful proponents of the Sankhya school say that the embryo and the sprout and so on arise without conditions, but the pot and so on arise with conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since they do not arise from their own nature, all things do not arise from their own nature.

original: thams cad las thams cad skye ba bgag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye ba bgag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not logical because it refutes that everything arises from everything.

original: de ltar re zhig ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, first, there is no arising from self.

original: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
translated: Those who assert that God is the cause say:üîΩThe one who is subtle, single, and abides as the source

original: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis @51b 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
analyzed: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis @51b 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
translated: creates all this and causes it to perish.

original: de ni dbang dag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya //
analyzed: de ni dbang dag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya //
translated: He is the lord, the giver of power, and the god to be worshipped.

original: yon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
analyzed: yon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
translated: He is the one who acts with qualities and attains complete peace.

original: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
analyzed: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
translated: This creator is not known to exist.

original: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //
analyzed: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //
translated: I have no power over my own happiness and suffering.

original: dbang phyug gis btang yang nag yang sa'am //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis btang yang nag yang sa'am //
translated: Even if he sends them to the realm of Yama,

original: mtho ris dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //üîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: mtho ris dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur // zhes zer ro //
translated: they will go only to the higher realms.

original: de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste /
translated: This is mere assertion.

original: dbang phyug ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible that God is the cause of the origination of the entire world even conventionally,

original: la la'i dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: because he is the cause of the pleasure and pain of some. For example, like a cowherd.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug ces bya ba gcig pu dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug ces bya ba gcig pu dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te /
translated: Moreover, it is certain that the world does not possess a single God as its causal agent,

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dper na dbang phyug bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dper na dbang phyug bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
translated: because it is an object of knowledge, like God. Therefore, even conventionally, things do not originate from him.

original: dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
translated: If God is the cause, then the effect would be identical to him,üîΩdifferent from him,

original: gzhan du gyur pa'am /üîΩgnyi gar gyur pa zhig 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'am /üîΩgnyi gar gyur pa zhig 'gyur grang na /
translated: or both.

original: gang yang rung ba gcig tu rtog na yang dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig tu rtog na yang dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
translated: If one imagines that it is one of these, then it is refuted by the previous argument, and because the arising of existent and nonexistent things is also refuted, ultimately things do not arise from ƒ™≈õvara.

original: ji ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug ces bya ste /
analyzed: ji ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug ces bya ste /
translated: If one says that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the various worlds that are enumerated as sentient beings and inanimate objects,

original: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: because he generates their endurance, emergence, destruction, happiness, suffering, increase, and decrease, then this is an argument that proves what is already established for us in the context of conventional truth.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not in the context of ultimate truth,

original: don dam par las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the context of ultimate truth, the arising of karma is not accepted.

original: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas /
analyzed: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas /
translated: Those who assert puru·π£a as the cause assert that puru·π£a itself is the cause of the arising of the entire world.

original: pa ni ba sgra rnams kyi bzhin ;
analyzed: pa ni ba sgra rnams kyi bzhin ;
translated: like the sounds of the letters pa, pha, ba, bha, ma,üîΩlike water from a water crystal,

original: / chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: / chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: like the branches of a balsa tree.

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: It is the cause of all embodied beings.üîΩIn the same way, it is the cause of all that is produced and all that is not produced, and so on.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni g-yo bar mi byed pa dang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni g-yo bar mi byed pa dang ;
translated: In the same way, it is the cause of that which moves and that which does not move,

original: de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyi ga dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyi ga dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: that which is far and that which is near, that which is in between, that which is both, and that which is external to all.

original: 'dir 'gag pa ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'gag pa ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Here, cessation should be understood as in the case of those who assert that God is the cause.

original: lhag par yang brjod par bya ste /üîΩlhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang / dbang @52a * //
analyzed: lhag par yang brjod par bya ste / lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang / dbang @52a * //
translated: Moreover, this should be stated:

original: po'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: po'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the self, like the self of Yaj√±adatta.

original: yang na mchod sbyin gyi lus dang / dbang po'i tshigs kyi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te /üîΩbde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: yang na mchod sbyin gyi lus dang / dbang po'i tshigs kyi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Or, the self of Yaj√±adatta is not the agent of the collection of Yaj√±adatta‚Äôs body and sense faculties,

original: lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, and consciousness, like the collection of Devadatta‚Äôs body and sense faculties.

original: yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni /
analyzed: yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni /
translated: Or, the self that is bound

original: kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: is not the cause of all,

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas /
translated: because it is the self, like the self of the liberated one.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of phenomena is refuted, the fault of contradicting one‚Äôs own beliefs arises.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the reason is because it is the self, but it is not established because it is part of the meaning of the thesis,‚Äù

original: lan btab zin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lan btab zin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault because the response has already been given.

original: gang dag 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin te /
translated: Those who say, ‚ÄúOur self is only one,

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is designated as being different in different vases,

original: du ma nyid du nye bar brtags pas des na /
analyzed: du ma nyid du nye bar brtags pas des na /
translated: it is designated as being manifold.

original: dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Therefore, since there is no example, there is no refutation by inference,

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: and there is no fault in our thesis.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du /
translated: because, since space is unarisen, like a sky flower,üîΩit is simply words to prove that it is one, since it is just a nonentity.

original: dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir gcig pa nyid du grub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir gcig pa nyid du grub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And, since there is no inference that demonstrates that the self is one in general, even conventionally,

original: ci ste bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: one might think that the bound self is not different from the liberated self,

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is the self, like the liberated self.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag yod pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag yod pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the self that is liberated in the realm of nirvana that is devoid of the remainder of the aggregates is not established as being the same as the self that is bound in samsara, the fault mentioned above is not avoided.

original: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: An extensive analysis of this is presented in the Vigrahavyiivartani.

original: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas /
translated: Those who assert that God is the cause of the world maintain that God is the intrinsic nature that is the cause of the arising of the manifestations that end with the sprout.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te /
analyzed: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te /
translated: The cause of the various internal phenomena is definitely pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
translated: Because they possess these, it is known in the world that whatever possesses what is caused by it.

original: dper na tsan dan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsan dan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the essence of sandalwood, the chips, the container, and the ornament.

original: de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang / @52b sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang / @52b sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no //
translated: In the same way, the internal distinctions are also endowed with pleasure, pain, and delusion. Therefore, the cause of the internal distinctions is pleasure, pain, and delusion, as stated in the reason.

original: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The aggregates characterized by form, perception, mental formations, and consciousness should be understood as having the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are aggregates, like the aggregate of feeling. Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: de la 'dir tsan dan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do //
analyzed: de la 'dir tsan dan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do //
translated: Here, since sandalwood, etc. are not ultimately established, there is no example.

original: tha snyad du yang gti mug ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pas dpe ma grub bo //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang gti mug ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pas dpe ma grub bo //
translated: But delusion is included in the aggregate of dispositions, so your example is not established.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par nges te /
translated: And it is certain that things which are neither pleasure nor pain are not pleasure or pain,

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dper na shes pa bzhin pas de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pas kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dper na shes pa bzhin pas de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pas kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are objects of knowledge, like consciousness. Therefore, this is not reasonable even by inference.

original: shes pa spyir grub pa kho na las dpe nyid blangs pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa spyir grub pa kho na las dpe nyid blangs pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that there is no example, because the mere establishment of consciousness in general is taken as the example.

original: gtso bo ni chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo ni chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Primordial matter is not the cause of Mahat and so on,

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na skyes bu bzhin pas rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na skyes bu bzhin pas rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
translated: because it is not manifest, like a person. Therefore, this contradicts the inference of those who assert that primordial matter is the cause.

original: ji ste mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la bya na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ste mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la bya na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la /
translated: If the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not clear‚Äù refers to the state prior to manifestation, then there is the fault that the example lacks the property to be proven.

original: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If the meaning of the reason refers to the mere existence of consciousness, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because the reason is stated generally,

original: bye brag tu brjod na yang mjug sdud pa'i phyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu brjod na yang mjug sdud pa'i phyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: or because it is stated specifically but is taken as one due to the summary, that reductio is like an unestablished seeming reason.

original: rang bzhin dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The refutation of the general assertion that the cause is intrinsic nature, time, or Narayana should be viewed like the refutation of God.

original: des na de ltar dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, things are not produced causelessly.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig na re /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig na re /
translated: Some of the Samkhyas say:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Not from both, nor without a cause.üîΩIn no place and in no time

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Is there an existent arising.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: What they say is true, that there is no arising.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: But they are made manifest.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: They should be asked this:

original: gang dag cig ji ltar gsal bar byed /
analyzed: gang dag cig ji ltar gsal bar byed /
translated: What are they? How are they made manifest?

original: gal te dper na @53a * //
analyzed: gal te dper na @53a * //
translated: If they say, ‚ÄúFor example,

original: mar mes bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a pot, etc., by a lamp,‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag mar me ma skyes pas ji ltar gsal bar byed /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag mar me ma skyes pas ji ltar gsal bar byed /
translated: how can a lamp, which is not arisen, make manifest a pot, etc., which is not arisen?

original: rta'i rva ma skyes pa ni nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rta'i rva ma skyes pa ni nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ngo //
translated: The non-arisen horn of a rabbit can never be made manifest.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir de dag yod par khas blangs na yang smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir de dag yod par khas blangs na yang smra bar bya ste /
translated: But if they accept that they exist in order to establish the system of conventional truth, we reply:

original: mar mes bum pa la ci zhig byed /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa la ci zhig byed /
translated: What does a lamp do to a pot?

original: gal te gzung bar byed na ni de sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzung bar byed na ni de sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no //
translated: If it illuminates the object, then since it did not exist previously, it would be the cause of itself.

original: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na ni mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na ni mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no //
translated: If it illuminates the eye consciousness, then since it did not exist previously in the dark, it would be the cause of itself.

original: ji ste bum pa bzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed na yang de nyid byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste bum pa bzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed na yang de nyid byed pa yin no //
translated: If it illuminates the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot, then it would be the cause of itself.

original: 'on te gzung ba yin na ni de nyid snang ba yin pas yang mar mes ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba yin na ni de nyid snang ba yin pas yang mar mes ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is apprehended, then since it is illumination itself, what would a lamp do?

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin te /
translated: In our system, a so-called pot is a collection of primary elements and derivative form.

original: mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: Since it arises simultaneously with illumination when a lamp arises, therefore, conventionally, a thing is the cause of its continuum arising from its own cause.

original: snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so //
analyzed: snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so //
translated: because it is the cause that occurs simultaneously with the appearance, it is considered to be the illuminator.

original: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, the refutation of illumination is similar to the refutation of arising.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: That which is not illuminated does not illuminate,

original: chen po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because the great elements, etc., are not illuminated, like a sky-flower.

original: des na de ltar gsal ba yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar gsal ba yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, illumination is not good.

original: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Here, another commentator explains: Things do not arise even from a cause,

original: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //üîΩde la yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir gal te /
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do // de la yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir gal te /
translated: because the consequence would be that everything would always arise from everything.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon par 'dod na des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon par 'dod na des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: But in this case, because the statement is open to question, if the meaning of the words of the refutation of the probandum and the proof are accepted, then this is what is taught:

original: dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig las kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig las kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni mi rigs te /
translated: because things would arise from a cause, because something would arise from something else sometimes, and because undertaking would have a result.

original: sngar smras pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar smras pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not reasonable, because the previously stated errors would ensue.

original: ji ste gzhan du na yang don 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan du na yang don 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: If it is not so, then there is no connection between the meaning and the words.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is just as before.

original: des na de ltar rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin no //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: des na de ltar rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin no // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Therefore, in this way, things do not arise from a non-cause.

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is never the arising of any thing anywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied individually.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i @53b dngos po dag go //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i @53b dngos po dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù refers to the things of affliction and purification.

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mdzad pa'i mtha' dang / so so'i rgyud grub pa dag na yang ngo //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mdzad pa'i mtha' dang / so so'i rgyud grub pa dag na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnywhere‚Äù refers to one‚Äôs own place of action and the establishment of individual continua.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' yang ngo //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNever‚Äù means not even once.

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa mu stegs byed la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa mu stegs byed la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is established as having the special property of being unproduced, etc., which is not shared with the tƒ´rthikas.

original: da ni rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: da ni rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Now, the Buddhist schools say:

original: rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
translated: There are four conditions: causal,

original: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
translated: objective, antecedent, and dominant.

original: ston pas mdo sde dang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: ston pas mdo sde dang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: The Teacher has stated in the s≈´tras and the treatises on Abhidharma

original: rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dang / lha yul dang / sa'i steng dag tu bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dang / lha yul dang / sa'i steng dag tu bka' stsal to //
translated: that these four conditions exist in the scriptures of our own and other schools, in the divine realms, and on the surface of the earth.

original: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin ;
analyzed: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin ;
translated: There is no fifth condition.

original: / sde pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rkyen mdun du skyes pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa rnams kyang 'di dag nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sde pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rkyen mdun du skyes pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa rnams kyang 'di dag nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conditions imagined by other schools, such as the arising of the object, the existent, and the nonexistent, are included in these four.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu lnga po dag go //
translated: The causal condition is the five causes: co-originating, homogeneous, concomitant, universal, and ripening.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition is all phenomena.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is all mental factors and mental states except for the final ones.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The dominant condition is the active cause.

original: bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag kho na las skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag kho na las skye bar 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that things arise from these four conditions.

original: de la bstan bcos byed pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med de zhes dam bcas par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bstan bcos byed pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med de zhes dam bcas par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the author of the treatise states that the assertion that things do not arise from others is undermined by what is accepted.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The intrinsic reality of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist in conditions and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on refers to:üîΩThe intrinsic reality of thingsüîΩDoes not exist in non-conditions.

original: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf things‚Äù refers to the eye, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù refers to their own nature.

original: rkyen la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConditions, etc.‚Äù refers to semen, blood, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas ni tshogs dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas ni tshogs dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan yang bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes other things, such as a collection, God, etc.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba na dgag pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba na dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not exist‚Äù is a negation.

original: de med pa'i phyir rkyen de dag su'i gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rkyen de dag su'i gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: Since they do not exist, of what would those conditions be other?

original: de yod du zin na yang de las skye ba med de /
analyzed: de yod du zin na yang de las skye ba med de /
translated: Even if they did exist, there would be no arising from them,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa smras zin pa'i phyir de la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa smras zin pa'i phyir de la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the refutation by inference has already been stated.

original: gang dag sgrub pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin par tshod dpags su brtags nas kho bo cag ni dngos po rnams gzhan dag las skye ba kho na yin no zhes ni nges par mi 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag sgrub pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin par tshod dpags su brtags nas kho bo cag ni dngos po rnams gzhan dag las skye ba kho na yin no zhes ni nges par mi 'dzin gyi /
translated: Those who imagine that the meaning of ‚Äúestablishment‚Äù is not real imagine that we definitely hold the position that things arise from other things.

original: gang dag skye ba de dag ni @54a * //
analyzed: gang dag skye ba de dag ni @54a * //
translated: Those that arise areüîΩ

original: gzhan kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan kho na las yin gyi /
translated: Those that arise arise from other.üîΩSince it is certain that they do not arise from themselves, therefore, even though other exists, they do not arise from nonconditions.

original: bdag las ma yin par nges par 'dzin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa dag las gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang skye ba med do zhes zer na de las gal te tshig de bdag las skye ba dgag pa lhur len pa yin na ni 'dod pa sgrubüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin par nges par 'dzin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa dag las gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang skye ba med do zhes zer na de las gal te tshig de bdag las skye ba dgag pa lhur len pa yin na ni 'dod pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If the meaning of that statement is to emphasize the refutation of arising from self, then it establishes what is already accepted.

original: 'on te ma skyes pa rnams gzhan las skye bar ston pa lhur len pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa rnams gzhan las skye bar ston pa lhur len pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it emphasizes the teaching that nonarisen things arise from other,

original: de lta na yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then the error of the same consequence would apply.

original: de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: That also is unacceptable.

original: ji ste gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de las gzhan skye ba dgag pa yin na ni dpe sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de las gzhan skye ba dgag pa yin na ni dpe sgrub pa yin no //
translated: But if the meaning of that statement is to emphasize the refutation of arising from other, then the example is established.

original: de lta na des ni mig la sogs pa khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams la med pa nyid dang / mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi chos smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na des ni mig la sogs pa khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams la med pa nyid dang / mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi chos smras pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has stated that the eye and so on do not exist in the conditions such as semen and blood, and that the conditions of the eye and so on are empty of them.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: there is no extrinsic reality.

original: rkyen la sogs pa la bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa la bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na'o //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality in the conditions and so on,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan dag las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan dag las 'byung ngo //
translated: extrinsic reality arises from others.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste rkyen rnams la med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste rkyen rnams la med do //
translated: Arising is production, and it does not exist in the conditions.

original: des ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning to be proven.

original: de ltar na 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du dpe mngon pas 'bras bu dang / rkyen phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du dpe mngon pas 'bras bu dang / rkyen phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, as before, the example is stated, and the two syllogistic statements are made from the perspective of the effect and the conditions.üîΩUltimately, the sense spheres such as the eye are not produced from conditions such as semen and blood,

original: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de /
translated: because they do not ariseüîΩfrom themselves,üîΩfrom others,üîΩfrom both,üîΩor without relying on causes.

original: de dag la med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they do not exist in them, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du don dam par khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately, the conditions of semen, blood, etc. do not produce the sense-spheres of eye, etc.

original: de dag gis stong pa'i phyir dper na thag bzangs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gis stong pa'i phyir dper na thag bzangs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are empty of them, like Devadatta, etc.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal ba med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal ba med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the Lord has not declared that ultimately things are produced from the four conditions, cause, etc.

original: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang ; de ma thag pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang ; de ma thag pa dang /
translated: In order to teach the conventional truth as it is, out of compassion for people whose minds are confused by the doctrines of causelessness and discordant causes, the conditions of cause,üîΩobjective source, immediately preceding,

original: bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste /
translated: and dominant should be understood as declared.

original: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with our position.

original: yang na gzhan du rnam par brtag ste gang dag dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'o zhes ston par byed pa de dag gi phyir yang 'di dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan du rnam par brtag ste gang dag dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'o zhes ston par byed pa de dag gi phyir yang 'di dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Or else, we can analyze this in another way: those who teach that things arise from other should also be analyzed in this way.üîΩIn this regard, the four conditions are:

original: 'di la / rkyen rnam bzhi @54b ste rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: 'di la / rkyen rnam bzhi @54b ste rgyu dang ni //
translated: The causal condition,

original: dmigs pa de ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
translated: the objective condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition.

original: zhes bya ba de dag dngos po skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod pa dang / sde pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa dang / bye brag pa la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag dngos po skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod pa dang / sde pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa dang / bye brag pa la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa /
translated: These are asserted to be the producers of things, and other schools imagine them to be the conditions of things, and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on imagine them to be the conditions of things.

original: ming tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mtshan nyid kyis de dag nyid du 'dus pas de'i phyir /üîΩrkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: ming tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mtshan nyid kyis de dag nyid du 'dus pas de'i phyir / rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
translated: But since they are included within those conditions by their characteristics,

original: zhes nges par bya ste brjod do //
analyzed: zhes nges par bya ste brjod do //
translated: it is certain that a fifth condition does not exist.

original: don dam par de dag gzhan nyid yin pa kho nar mi rigs so //
analyzed: don dam par de dag gzhan nyid yin pa kho nar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical for them to be other in the ultimate.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The intrinsic reality of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: does not exist in conditions, etc.

original: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe intrinsic reality of things‚Äù refers to

original: nang gi dang / cha phra ba dang / rags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nang gi dang / cha phra ba dang / rags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: the internal, the subtle, and the gross.

original: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIntrinsic reality‚Äù means their own nature.

original: rkyen la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni re zhig rkyen so so dang 'dus pa dag la'o //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni re zhig rkyen so so dang 'dus pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn conditions, etc.‚Äù means in conditions individually and in their collection.

original: sogs la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu dang byed rgyu thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa tshogs pa dang gzhan dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu dang byed rgyu thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa tshogs pa dang gzhan dag la yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to causes, cooperative causes, common causes, uncommon causes, and other collections.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúDoes not exist‚Äù means it does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji ltar zhe na /
translated: When and how?

original: skye ba'i sngon rol na tha snyad dang don dam par ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sngon rol na tha snyad dang don dam par ro //
translated: Prior to arising, in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.üîΩThe root text says:

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If its own reality does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: another‚Äôs reality does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po skye bar 'dod pa na de nyid yod pa ma yin na ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po skye bar 'dod pa na de nyid yod pa ma yin na ;
translated: If the arising of a thing‚Äôs own entity is asserted, then it does not exist.

original: rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan nyid yod par ji ltar 'gyur bas gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan nyid yod par ji ltar 'gyur bas gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: How could the otherness of other conditions exist? Therefore, otherness does not exist at all.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that there is no reason for otherness.

original: ji ste dngos po skye bar 'dod pa blo la rnam par bzhag nas rkyen de dag gzhan du gyur pa yin te /üîΩltos pa'i dbang gis so zhe'am /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po skye bar 'dod pa blo la rnam par bzhag nas rkyen de dag gzhan du gyur pa yin te / ltos pa'i dbang gis so zhe'am /
translated: If you posit the arising of a thing in the mind and then assert that those conditions are other,üîΩthen it is merely a convention that is posited through the power of dependence,

original: gzhan nyid dang ldan pas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs na de ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang ldan pas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs na de ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
translated: or it is a convention that is posited through the possession of otherness.

original: de dag la gzhan gyi dngos po nyid med pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan gyi dngos po nyid med pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Since those do not have otherness, one should not cling to them.

original: tha snyad du gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: tha snyad du gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if otherness exists conventionally,

original: don dam par de las skye ba med par sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: don dam par de las skye ba med par sngar bstan zin to //
translated: it has been shown previously that ultimately arising from other does not exist.

original: grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de //
analyzed: grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas respond to this refutation.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: The nature of things exists in the conditions in a subtle form alone.

original: de yang phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pas /
analyzed: de yang phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pas /
translated: And since it is accepted that it is later made manifest,üîΩeven though the effect is not manifest, the conditions are established as other.

original: 'bras bu gsal bar ma gyur kyang rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsal bar ma gyur kyang rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir de ni mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this is not a refutation.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /üîΩ'jig rten na grags pa bum pa @55a * //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te / 'jig rten na grags pa bum pa @55a * //
translated: This is not good,

original: la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / gsal ba'i lan yang btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / gsal ba'i lan yang btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to demonstrate the subtle nature of such things as pots that are renowned in the world, and because the response that they are manifest has already been given.

original: grangs can dag las gzhan dag na re gal te 'bras bu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen gzhan dag las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub pa la sgrub bo //
analyzed: grangs can dag las gzhan dag na re gal te 'bras bu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen gzhan dag las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub pa la sgrub bo //
translated: Others apart from the Samkhyas argue as follows: If you prove that an effect does not arise from conditions that are empty of the capacity for the effect,

original: 'on te skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na ni ther zug tu gnas par smra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na ni ther zug tu gnas par smra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes zer ro //
translated: then if you say that it does not arise at all, you are accepting the position that it endures permanently, and so you are refuted.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: rnam pa thams cad du skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you are refuting arising in all ways.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that it endures eternally,

original: dngos po ma skyes pa'i tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /üîΩbam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: dngos po ma skyes pa'i tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro / // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: because you accept that a non-arisen thing exists conventionally.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: rkyen rnams kho nas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kho nas 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The conditions themselves do not generate effects,

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis rkyen dang ldan pas de skyed par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis rkyen dang ldan pas de skyed par 'dod do //
translated: because the activity of the arising of consciousness is possessed of conditions, and it is asserted that it is generated by the conditions of the eye, form, light, space, and attention.

original: kho bo cag gis de yang yod par smra bar nus te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis de yang yod par smra bar nus te /
translated: We can also say that it exists,

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: because ultimately the activity of the arising of consciousness is the generator of its own effect.

original: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang / 'bras thug po che dang ; me dang / bud shing gi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang / 'bras thug po che dang ; me dang / bud shing gi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it has conditions, like the conditions of cooking rice‚Äîthe pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the previous inferences are undermined by this later argument.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: An action does not have conditions.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad smras pa'i de'i rtog ge phyi mas de la gnod par 'gyur ba 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba kho bo cag don dam par khas mi len pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa dpe mchad ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na / bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad smras pa'i de'i rtog ge phyi mas de la gnod par 'gyur ba 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba kho bo cag don dam par khas mi len pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa dpe mchad ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro // yang na / bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: Because of what was said, this later argument of yours undermines your own position. Since we do not accept the action of cooking rice ultimately, your argument has the fault of having a premise that is not established for you.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the line ‚ÄúAn action does not have conditions‚Äù means that ultimately the action of producing consciousness does not have conditions.

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa skye ba phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ don dam par de skad brjod na ni bya bas skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa skye ba phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ; / don dam par de skad brjod na ni bya bas skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because later on, the arising of an existent or nonexistent effect will be refuted.üîΩIf you say that in the ultimate sense, the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: because the arising of consciousness is an action.

original: spyir de skad brjod na yang don 'gal ba nyid de /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid skye ba'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob tu shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: spyir de skad brjod na yang don 'gal ba nyid de / rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid skye ba'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob tu shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Even if you say that in general, the meaning is contradictory,üîΩbecause the activity of the arising of the nature of consciousness is a condition,

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the object of consciousness in the conventional sense, because it is not the case that it does not arise.

original: 'di la @55b gzhan ni gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang / gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la @55b gzhan ni gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang / gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
translated: What can this other person do to us by saying that things arise from self, from another, and so on?

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Because the eye and so on are the conditions for the activity of the arising of eye consciousness,üîΩjust as a pot and so on are the conditions for the activity of cooking.

original: dper na phru ba la sogs pa btso ba'i bya ba'i rkyen yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na phru ba la sogs pa btso ba'i bya ba'i rkyen yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the teaching that things arise, he says:

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: An action does not possess conditions.

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / skye bzhin pa la rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / skye bzhin pa la rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do //
translated: Because it is untenable that consciousness generates an action that has already arisen, has not yet arisen, or is in the process of arising.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a correct response.

original: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis ka dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis ka dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both the opponent‚Äôs position and your response are mere assertions.

original: 'dir sun phyung ba'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir sun phyung ba'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
translated: Here, after superimposing the meaning of the refutation, you say:

original: gal te bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med pas dpe med du zin kyang re zhig bya ba ni yod pas de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de ltar rjes su dpag pa smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med pas dpe med du zin kyang re zhig bya ba ni yod pas de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de ltar rjes su dpag pa smra bar bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the example is not established because an action does not possess conditions since it has not arisen, since an action exists, it is like this: just as there is a consequence, so too there is an inference.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya ba ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: The action that generates consciousness generates its own effect.

original: bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras chan btso ba'i bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an action, like the action of cooking rice.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩrkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThere is no action without conditions.

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis khyad par can du ma byas pa'i bya ba 'ba' zhig kyang med de /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis khyad par can du ma byas pa'i bya ba 'ba' zhig kyang med de /
translated: Because it is without conditions, an action that is not distinguished is also nonexistent.

original: snga ma bzhin pas smras ma thag pa'i skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin pas smras ma thag pa'i skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the previous explanation, the error just mentioned would ensue.

original: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i don gzhan du smra ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i don gzhan du smra ste /
translated: Others explain the meaning of the verse differently.

original: gang gi phyogs la skye ba'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩbya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la skye ba'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i phyir / bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: If the action of arising were to exist in the nature of consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: then this would be stated:üîΩ‚ÄúAction does not possess conditions.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action of the arising of consciousness does not exist, like consciousness, it is not tenable that it possesses conditions in the sense of being related to them.

original: gang gi phyogs la bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de'i phyir ni /üîΩrkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de'i phyir ni / rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: Because it does not exist as an intrinsic reality in any way,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúThere is no action without conditions.‚Äù

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it does not have conditions, it does not exist by itself.

original: kha cig na re rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas /
translated: Some say: Since conditions mutually benefit each other,

original: de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: an entity arises in the instant that it obtains the action of being able to generate an effect in the next instant. Since the arising of that is not relinquished conventionally, it is not nonexistent.

original: ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin pa dang / dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan gyi phyogs dam bcas pa tsam sun 'byin par byed pas de ni @56a * //
analyzed: ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin pa dang / dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan gyi phyogs dam bcas pa tsam sun 'byin par byed pas de ni @56a * //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is not illogical, and the position of others is refuted by mere assertion.

original: don ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: don ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: This is not the meaning.

original: skye bar smra ba gzhan dag gzhan gyis phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba gzhan dag gzhan gyis phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Other proponents of arising refute the others‚Äô position.

original: mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: The eye and so on are only producers of the eye consciousness,

original: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la sogs pa myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la sogs pa myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: because they possess the action of producing, just as the seed, the earth, water, fire, wind, and so on are producers of the sprout.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the previous inferences are not undermined by the later logicians.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: Conditions do not possess action.

original: 'di la don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir bya ba med pas sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams de dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir bya ba med pas sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams de dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, because arising is ultimately refuted, the seed and so on do not possess action, and so they are not conditions.

original: bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rkyen du mi rung bas de dag rkyen nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe ma tshang bas rtog ge phyi mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rkyen du mi rung bas de dag rkyen nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe ma tshang bas rtog ge phyi mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since those that do not possess action are not suitable as conditions, they are not established as conditions. Therefore the example is incomplete, and so the later logicians do not undermine us.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: don dam par 'bru la sogs pa la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩkun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir gang kun rdzob tu ji ltar khas len pa de ni don dam par yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bru la sogs pa la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yod pa kho na yin te / kun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir gang kun rdzob tu ji ltar khas len pa de ni don dam par yang de bzhin te /
translated: In fact, seeds and so on do have activity.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva med pa bzhin no //
translated: Because you accept that conventionally, whatever you accept conventionally exists ultimately, just like the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: khyed kyang kun rdzob tu 'bru la sogs pa la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid khas len pas de'i phyir dpe grub pas 'dod pa grub bo //
analyzed: khyed kyang kun rdzob tu 'bru la sogs pa la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid khas len pas de'i phyir dpe grub pas 'dod pa grub bo //
translated: You accept that seeds and so on have activity conventionally. Therefore, since the example is established, the thesis is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //
analyzed: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //
translated: Whether or not they have activity,

original: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: this is the context.

original: de lta na yang rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even so, conditions are not established as having activity,

original: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even conventionally, the activity of the rabbit‚Äôs horns is not established.

original: don dam par ri bong gi rva yang med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ri bong gi rva yang med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because even ultimately, the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns is not established,

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: the fault stated does not apply.

original: ci ste yang grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste yang grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: But if the Samkhyas still object,

original: ri bong gi rva'i med pa ni dngos po yod pa kho na yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva'i med pa ni dngos po yod pa kho na yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: saying that the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns is a thing, in order to demonstrate that, and because it is the basis of distinction,

original: gzugs dang autpala sngon po bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang autpala sngon po bzhin no zhe na /
translated: it is like form and the blue lotus.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: don dam par gzugs dang autpala sngon po gnyis kyi yod pa nyid dang / khyad par gyi gzhi nyid ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste kho bo cag gis khyed la gzugs la sogs pa yod par ston mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs dang autpala sngon po gnyis kyi yod pa nyid dang / khyad par gyi gzhi nyid ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba'i phyir ro // ci ste kho bo cag gis khyed la gzugs la sogs pa yod par ston mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: because ultimately the existence of both form and the blue lotus and the basis of distinction itself are not established, so the example is incomplete.üîΩBut if you say that just as we cannot demonstrate the existence of form and so on to you,

original: khyed kyis kyang kho bo cag la gzugs la sogs pa med par ston mi nus par 'dra bas skyon mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang kho bo cag la gzugs la sogs pa med par ston mi nus par 'dra bas skyon mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: in the same way you cannot demonstrate the nonexistence of form and so on to us, so the fault is similar,

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos @56b po med par lta ba spangs par 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos @56b po med par lta ba spangs par 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi
translated: Because of the mere negation of arising, things are negated as possessing nonarising, and because it does not teach that one should abandon the view of nonthings, it falls to the extreme of the view of both things and nonthings.üîΩ

original: 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Because the mere negation of arising possesses nonarising, it is the negation of things, and because it does not teach the abandonment of the view of nonthings, how could it be similar to the error of those who fall to the two extremes of the views of things and nonthings?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir de bsgrub par mi 'dod pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir de bsgrub par mi 'dod pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because there is no inference that teaches things and nonthings, since we do not assert that it proves things and nonthings, only our assertion is established.

original: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not establish our own position.

original: yang na skye bar smra ba dag la dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na skye bar smra ba dag la dri bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, we should ask the proponents of arising:

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin nam bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na /
