analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin nam bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na /
translated: If you accept the former,

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩbya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: then this is explained:

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yi //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yi //
translated: Conditions that lack activity are not conditions.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the statement,üîΩ‚Äúthat which generates the effect.‚Äù

original: bya ba mi ldan zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya bas stong pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba mi ldan zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya bas stong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLacking activity‚Äù means empty of the activity of generating the effect that is desired.

original: gang dag ji skad bstan pa de dag ni de skyed par byed pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang dag ji skad bstan pa de dag ni de skyed par byed pa ma yin te ;
translated: Those that are taught in that way do not generate it,

original: des stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes de bstan zin to //
analyzed: des stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes de bstan zin to //
translated: because they are empty of that, just like anything else.

original: 'on te bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they possess activity,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then this is explained:

original: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //
analyzed: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //
translated: Do they possess activity or not?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context.

original: 'on te na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù has the meaning of an alternative.

original: 'di la rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'bras bu skyed pas bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di la rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'bras bu skyed pas bstan pa yin na /
translated: Here, conditions are said to be endowed with activity by producing effects.

original: de yang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: But since it is not accepted that they are directed toward the production of effects, therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: mdo sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag na re /
translated: SautrƒÅntikas say:

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus kho na rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus kho na rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir / gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: At the time of the production of the effect, conditions endowed with activity mutually benefit each other and are accepted as conditions.üîΩTherefore the meaning of the reason is not not established.

original: rtog ge phyi ma med pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtog ge phyi ma med pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Nor is the latter part of the argument invalid.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
analyzed: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
translated: Since they arise in dependence on them,üîΩthey are known as conditions.

original: de phyir 'di dag rkyen zhes grag /'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye bas na de'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grag go //
analyzed: de phyir 'di dag rkyen zhes grag /'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye bas na de'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grag go //
translated: Since effects and so on arise in dependence on them, therefore you SautrƒÅntikas assert that ultimately these effects and so on are conditions.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba ni 'dir slob dpon mi bzhed par ston pa yin no //üîΩde'i phyir / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba ni 'dir slob dpon mi bzhed par ston pa yin no // de'i phyir / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
translated: The application of the term ‚Äúsound‚Äù is not accepted by the master here.üîΩTherefore:

original: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
translated: As long as they do not produce, how could they not be nonconditions?

original: 'bras bu ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du 'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag @57a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du 'bras bu la sogs pa 'di dag @57a * //
translated: As long as the effect does not arise, how could these, the so-called conditions,

original: rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: not be nonconditions?

original: 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnonconditions‚Äù is that they are not conditions.

original: dper na ji srid du mi klog pa de srid du mkhas pa ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ji srid du mi klog pa de srid du mkhas pa ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, as long as a person does not read, how could he not be unlearned?

original: ji ste 'di skad ces kho bo cag 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams rkyen nyid du khas mi len pas de'i phyir de mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste 'di skad ces kho bo cag 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams rkyen nyid du khas mi len pas de'i phyir de mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúWe do not accept that prior to the arising of the effect the conditions are conditions, therefore this does not undermine our position,‚Äù

original: mi gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not that it does not undermine it.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol du rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan bcos mdzad pa ston par bzhed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol du rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan bcos mdzad pa ston par bzhed do //
translated: Since here the conditions are shown to be non-conditions prior to the arising of the effect, the treatise is composed in order to show that they are non-conditions at the time of the arising of the effect.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the effect and so on are not the nature of conditions at the time of the arising of the sprout,

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are not to be expressed as being the same or different, just as they are in the previous moment.üîΩThis shows that things do not arise from self, other, or both.

original: 'dis ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: To that, some may say, ‚ÄúThis is the establishment of what is already established,

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the effect and the cause are not to be expressed as being the same or different.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: Even though they are not expressible, they are only producers of effects.

original: skye bar smra ba dag yang phyir zlog par byed do //
analyzed: skye bar smra ba dag yang phyir zlog par byed do //
translated: The proponents of arising respond:

original: don dam par de dag gi rkyen rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de dag gi rkyen rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, those conditions are only producers of the internal sense spheres,

original: rkyen yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are conditions, like, for example, a seed that produces a sprout.

original: gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de la ni rkyen nyid med de /
analyzed: gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de la ni rkyen nyid med de /
translated: That which is not a producer is not a condition,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like, for example, the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la gal te don dam par rkyen zhig yin par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te don dam par rkyen zhig yin par gyur na /
translated: In this regard, if in reality something is a condition,

original: yod pa'am med pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa zhig yin grang /
translated: is it existent or nonexistent?

original: de dag gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs pas mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable for it to be both, becauseüîΩtherefore, it is said:üîΩIt is not tenable for a condition

original: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: to be existent or nonexistent.

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: Conditions are not tenable in the absence of effects.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is stated.

original: 'di ni dam bcas pa gnyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bcas pa gnyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the second thesis.

original: de la med pa'i rkyen du ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la med pa'i rkyen du ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni /
translated: Here, in order to demonstrate how conditions are not tenable in the absence of effects, he says:

original: med na gang gis rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gis rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If they do not exist, what would conditions be conditions of?

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is stated.

original: 'di na nam mkha' me tog la sogs pa med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lhug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di na nam mkha' me tog la sogs pa med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lhug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, in the absence of sky-flowers and so on, what would the conditions of a mango and so on be?

original: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes @57b bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes @57b bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The point of this statement is that they are not the conditions of sky-flowers and the horns of a rabbit.

original: de ni chos mthun pa'i dper bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos mthun pa'i dper bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of a concordant example.

original: 'bras bu med na rkyen gyi chos ni 'bras bu med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med na rkyen gyi chos ni 'bras bu med pa nyid yin la /
translated: If effects do not exist, the phenomena of conditions would be devoid of effects.

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyang med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyang med pa nyid yin no //
translated: And the phenomena of effects would be devoid of conditions.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa la rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa la rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: ultimately, the nature of conditions does not exist in effects and so on.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because they have no effect.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: For example, like space, because a sky-flower does not exist.

original: de bzhin du don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa yang myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa yang myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately, the effect and so on are not conditions of the sprout,

original: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because they do not exist, for example, like a sky-flower.

original: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces med pa skye bar ni mi 'dod kyi skye ba can ni skye bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces med pa skye bar ni mi 'dod kyi skye ba can ni skye bar 'dod pa /
translated: Again, those who say, ‚ÄúWe do not assert the arising of the nonexistent, but we assert the arising of that which has arising,‚ÄùüîΩbecause of the nonexistence of the prior,

original: snga na med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir /üîΩmed na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir / med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: for them it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: If nonexistent, of what would they be conditions?

original: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bum pa dang snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa med pa nyid yin na yang med pa gang gi rkyen du 'bras bu la sogs pa 'dod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bum pa dang snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa med pa nyid yin na yang med pa gang gi rkyen du 'bras bu la sogs pa 'dod de /
translated: If the nonexistent characterized by nonexistence prior to arising, such as a vase, cloth, or a plant, were nonexistent, of what nonexistent would the effect and so on be asserted to be conditions?

original: gang gi phyir yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: Because they would not be, this is the meaning of the words.

original: de'i phyir yang de khong du chud pa kho nar byed nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de khong du chud pa kho nar byed nus te /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to understand it in this way alone.

original: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa ni myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu la sogs pa ni myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, the effect and so on are not conditions of the sprout,

original: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they do not exist prior to the sprout, just like a pot and so on.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang /
translated: In the second case,

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: if it exists, what would the conditions do?

original: yod na yang myu gu rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni tha snyad du yang 'bras bu la sogs pa rkyen yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: yod na yang myu gu rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni tha snyad du yang 'bras bu la sogs pa rkyen yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: If it exists, then even conventionally, the effect and so on are not conditions of the sprout that exists by its own nature,

original: skyed pa'i byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa de nyid dam bum pa la sogs pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: skyed pa'i byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa de nyid dam bum pa la sogs pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it does not rely on the activity of arising, just like that sprout itself or another pot and so on.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa de ni rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa de ni rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that that which exists is made manifest by the conditions and is made coarse.

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what would conditions do?

original: zhes bya ba de mi rigs so zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de mi rigs so zhes zer na /
translated: Thus, it is illogical to say that conditions are necessary for the generation of effects.

original: de dag gi gsal ba yang bsal zin pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid kyang yod pa dang ; / med pa nyid la ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gsal ba yang bsal zin pa'i phyir dang / rags pa nyid kyang yod pa dang ; / med pa nyid la ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
translated: But since we have already refuted the manifestation of things and since the faults that we have explained would ensue for the existence or nonexistence of gross objects, this is untenable.

original: mdo sde pa dag na re /üîΩmed dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag na re / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: The Sautrantikas say:üîΩConditions are not tenable

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: For a nonexistent or existent object.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden na /
translated: This is true,

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i tshe na /
translated: but when an effect is about to arise,

original: rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan dogs pa la @58a * //
analyzed: rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan dogs pa la @58a * //
translated: conditions are mutually dependentüîΩand are capable of producing the effect.

original: brten nas 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thos pa dag don dam par rkyen nyid du khas len pas de'i tshe na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: brten nas 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thos pa dag don dam par rkyen nyid du khas len pas de'i tshe na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
translated: At that time, since the effect is in the process of arising, it is not nonexistent.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i bsgrub pa'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i bsgrub pa'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it does not arise, it does not exist. Therefore, as we have said, there is no fault in our position.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩIn that case,

original: brtag pa de la yang /
analyzed: brtag pa de la yang /
translated: conditions are not tenable

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: with respect to a nonexistent or existent object.

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That is, it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyir / de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.

original: 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is that it is not tenable that conditions exist or do not exist.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pas /üîΩdon dam par mig la sogs par de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pas /üîΩdon dam par mig la sogs par de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot tenable‚Äù is

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because their effect is not to be described as existent or nonexistent,

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de ni lan ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de ni lan ma yin no //
translated: like something else, that is not an answer.

original: tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po skye ba yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po skye ba yang 'grub bo //
translated: Also, the arising of things that are devoid of the nature of existing conventionally, etc., is established.

original: ji ste yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na de dag kyang phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bstsal
analyzed: ji ste yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na de dag kyang phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bstsal
translated: But if the proponents of the two truths say that the error stated does not arise because they accept that conditions are the causes of existent and nonexistent effects, then we reply that they are not spared, because the refutation of the proponents of the two truths is stated in both of the two truths.

original: ba'i phyir dbugs mi sbyin to //
analyzed: ba'i phyir dbugs mi sbyin to //
translated: Therefore, we do not hold our breath waiting for their response.

original: de ltar re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having generally refuted conditions,

original: de dag khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de dag khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas 'di bshad do //
translated: we now explain this in order to refute them in particular.

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: First, from the perspective of the causal condition,

original: 'di la rkyen rnams spyi yin yang bskyed par bya ba skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de rkyen du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di la rkyen rnams spyi yin yang bskyed par bya ba skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de rkyen du 'dod do //
translated: Although conditions are in general, that which is a condition that generates what is to be generated is asserted to be a condition.

original: 'o na bskyed par bya ba skye ba ni tshogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhe na skye ba dgag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na bskyed par bya ba skye ba ni tshogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhe na skye ba dgag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Well, since the generation of what is to be generated depends on the assemblage, the generator is not singular. Although it is accepted that this is untenable in order to refute arising,

original: 'on kyang tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: nevertheless, having accepted the presentation of conventional causes, it should be explained how ultimate causes are untenable.

original: 'di la rgyu ni 'di yin te //üîΩyod pa'am med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni 'di yin te // yod pa'am med pa'am /
translated: Here, the reason is this:üîΩIf it is asserted that an existent, a nonexistent,

original: yod med cig sgrub pa yin par 'dod grang na /
analyzed: yod med cig sgrub pa yin par 'dod grang na /
translated: or an existent and nonexistent is established,üîΩthen,üîΩWhen a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: de yang / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //üîΩde yi @58b tshe na don dam par //
analyzed: de yang / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa // de yi @58b tshe na don dam par //
translated: nonexistent, or existent and nonexistent,üîΩat that time,üîΩhow could it be called an ultimate

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: that is established by a cause?

original: de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: That is not a cause that establishes anything at all.

original: yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir bdag dang / gzhan bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir bdag dang / gzhan bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it exists and does not exist, like self and other, respectively, and because it is subject to the fallacy of both positions.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because the cause of a cause is untenable, it is also untenable.

original: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pas bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pas bstan pa yin na /
translated: The cause of a cause is taught to be the establishment of what is to be produced.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni /
translated: But because the possessor of a cause is not established by its own nature, which is characterized as existent, etc.,

original: tha snyad pa yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad pa yin la /
translated: the arising of the possessor of a cause from a cause is a convention.

original: rgyu yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur bas grub bo //
analyzed: rgyu yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur bas grub bo //
translated: And because a cause is just like that, it is established.

original: yang na rang gi sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: yang na rang gi sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Or, our own schools may object:

original: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa rgyu la sogs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa rgyu la sogs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The cause, etc., which produce the internal sense bases, definitely exist.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir dang gang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir dang gang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa de ni de bzhin te /
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata has said that, and whatever the TathƒÅgata says is just so.

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just so that nirvƒÅ·πáa is peace.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúThe cause is the producer.

original: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the object of mind and mental factors.

original: de ma thag pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The antecedent is the cessation of mind and mental factors, except for the last.

original: bdag po ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: bdag po ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The dominant condition is that when something exists, something else arises.‚Äù

original: de ltar rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since causes and so on, the conditions, exist as the intrinsic reality of conditions,

original: gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: the intended meaning is not undermined because the reason is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: kun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i skyon brjod pas lan btab zin pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i skyon brjod pas lan btab zin pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because we accept that conventionally, and because we have already answered this objection by the example, this is not a correct objection.

original: yang brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: Again, we should investigate and inquire:

original: 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod pa gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of your reason?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu de skad gsungs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu de skad gsungs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Is it because the TathƒÅgata said that conventionally,

original: 'on te don dam par gsungs pa'i phyir gal te kun rdzob tu na ni rang la don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te don dam par gsungs pa'i phyir gal te kun rdzob tu na ni rang la don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: or is it because he said that ultimately? If it is because of the conventional, then the meaning is not established for you.

original: 'on te don dam par na ni //
analyzed: 'on te don dam par na ni //
translated: But if it is because of the ultimate,üîΩthen when existence in this life is not established,

original: gang tshe tshe 'di yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe tshe 'di yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
translated: nonexistence, both existence and nonexistence, and neither is not established.

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, because the existence, nonexistence, and both the existence and the nonexistence of the effect are refuted,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: how could the cause be established as existent,üîΩas nonexistent, as both existent and nonexistent, or as neither?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were like that, it would not be tenable.

original: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that it is not a cause for establishing.

original: de'i phyir @59a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @59a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: don dam par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: because the object to be established and the means of establishment are not established ultimately, the meaning of the reason is not established and the meaning is contradictory.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la gzhung mi gzugs pa'i rnam pa yongs su bzung bas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin pas de la dgag par bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la gzhung mi gzugs pa'i rnam pa yongs su bzung bas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin pas de la dgag par bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Since the teaching of the Treatise on the Middle Way is taken to be the complete teaching, the absence of intrinsic reality is to be taught. Therefore, there are two objects of negation:

original: rjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: attachment to expression and attachment to the expressed.

original: de la skye ba bkag pas ni brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa bkag go //
analyzed: de la skye ba bkag pas ni brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa bkag go //
translated: Among them, the negation of arising negates attachment to the expressed.

original: rjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas /
analyzed: rjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas /
translated: Desiring to negate attachment to expression,üîΩwhen a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could the cause be established?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were so, it would not be tenable.

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rgyur 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rgyur 'dod na /
translated: Here the condensed meaning is this: If you assert that the cause is accepted because it establishes the effect,

original: de yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la yang mi srid pas rgyur brjod pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la yang mi srid pas rgyur brjod pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: then since it is impossible for the effect to exist, not exist, or be both, the cause is not tenable because the cause of engaging the expression ‚Äúcause‚Äù does not exist.

original: rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi rigs pas dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi rigs pas dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
translated: Since the cause itself is not tenable, it is said that things arise only because their cause exists.

original: rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: But that is not established.üîΩOthers say: Things arise ultimately

original: gzhan dag na re don dam par dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don dam par dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
translated: because they arise in the world.

original: rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni dngos po yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni dngos po yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause a cause exists‚Äù is not tenable as a definition of cause because it does not establish the existence, nonexistence, or both of an entity. Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the response has already been given.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi rkyen nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi rkyen nyid mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, in this way, the condition qua cause is not tenable.

original: de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rkyen nyid kyang ji ltar ma rigs pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rkyen nyid kyang ji ltar ma rigs pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The condition qua object should be analyzed in the same way that the condition qua cause is untenable.

original: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa ni //
translated: The object of an existent phenomenon

original: med pa kho nar nyi bar bstan //
analyzed: med pa kho nar nyi bar bstan //
translated: is clearly taught to be nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩyin pa'i zhes bya ba ni gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here,üîΩ‚Äúexistent‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving become.‚Äù

original: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPhenomenon‚Äù means ‚Äúthat which holds its own characteristics.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bro la bzhag pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bro la bzhag pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is called indicates the teaching of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dmigs par bya ba yin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dmigs par bya ba yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase the object refers to the objects of those consciousnesses.

original: dmigs pa ni gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The word object means that which is grasped.

original: dmigs pa med pa kho na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa kho na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase only without an object means:

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du'o //
translated: without an object.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa med ce na /
translated: How is it without an object?

original: don dam par de dag skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de dag skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ultimate non-arising of those consciousnesses is refuted.

original: @59b skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: @59b skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de /
translated: The phrase arising is not an object means that arising is not an object.

original: skye bzhin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Because it is arising, like form.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho nar nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho nar nye bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this is the teaching that these phenomena are only without an object.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /üîΩdmigs pa gang gis skye ba na //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te / dmigs pa gang gis skye ba na //
translated: The phrase with an object means that the system of conventional truth is established.üîΩBecause arising is with an object.

original: der snang ba skye ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: der snang ba skye ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Because arising is with an object, it is said to be with an object.

original: nor can bzhin du dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nor can bzhin du dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not like a rich man, who has them all at once.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: if the object does not exist,

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the ultimate non-existence of the object is because there is no apprehension of the object.

original: 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa nyid yongs su brtags pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa nyid yongs su brtags pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is not tenable to impute the nature of an object to that which is not an apprehension of something.

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How can there be an object?

original: 'di la dmigs pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the statement is that there is no object here at all.

original: dper na mtshams med pa byed pa la mngon par rtogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mtshams med pa byed pa la mngon par rtogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúHow can there be realization for one who commits an action with immediate result?‚Äù

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Even so, the reason is unestablished and contradictory.

original: gzhan dag yang rnam par brtag pa mtshungs par ltag chod sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag yang rnam par brtag pa mtshungs par ltag chod sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Others, seeing the same fault in their own position, apply a reductio to us:üîΩ‚ÄúForm is without an object,

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: because it is form,üîΩlike the form of the second moon.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na ;
translated: Because it is included in the form aggregate.üîΩIf you accept that it is logical for the treatise Attainment of Knowledge to state:üîΩWhat are phenomena that lack focal objects?üîΩForm and nirvana.

original: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bar rigs na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa gang yin pas ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bar rigs na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa gang yin pas ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Then it is illogical to accept that minds and mental factors lack focal objects, because it states:üîΩWhat are phenomena that possess focal objects?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung ba de khas len pas mi rigs so zhe na /üîΩde ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung ba de khas len pas mi rigs so zhe na / de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: They are minds and mental factors.

original: dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is illogical because it is an example that proves the opposite.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na yang dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na yang dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you state that it is not derived from the elements as a reason, then there is no example.

original: gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If they imagine that the meaning of those passages is that the object of observation is the apprehended object, then the apprehension of the apprehended object by mind and mental factors would be refuted,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul nyid kyis don dam par rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul nyid kyis don dam par rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, in the very manner stated, they do not accept that consciousness ultimately observes an object of observation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na gzugs la mi dmigs so //üîΩbyang chub dang ldan pa'i @60a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na gzugs la mi dmigs so // byang chub dang ldan pa'i @60a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also says, ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, when a bodhisattva practices in that way, he does not observe form.üîΩHe does not observe up to

original: bar la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bar la mi dmigs so //
translated: enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are not observed.

original: gang la 'di dag gi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i gzung ba'i chos rnams la cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la 'di dag gi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i gzung ba'i chos rnams la cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehended phenomena that would be their object of observation do not exist in the least.‚Äù

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin la rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin la rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this: form is not the domain of form, up to consciousness is not the domain of consciousness.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subh≈´ti, because it is not the domain, form does not know form, does not see form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo ;
translated: Up to consciousness also does not know consciousness, does not see consciousness.

original: / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which does not know, does not see form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, that is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin to //
translated: Thus the objective condition has been examined.

original: da ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs su bab pas de brtag par bya'o ;
analyzed: da ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs su bab pas de brtag par bya'o ;
translated: Now, since the immediately preceding condition is the topic at hand, that should be examined.

original: /'di la don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: /'di la don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore:

original: chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: Phenomena that are not produced

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Do not cease.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mgo gnyis pa dgag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mgo gnyis pa dgag pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are not produced, they are like a second head.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from this?

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is illogical.

original: don dam par te /
analyzed: don dam par te /
translated: Ultimately,

original: de nyid don dam par ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid don dam par ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: it is illogical because it is not established in reality and because it contradicts the point.

original: yang na spyir skye ba khas blangs na yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na spyir skye ba khas blangs na yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, even if one accepts production in general, it should be explained as follows.

original: 'di la de ma thag pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gag pa de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la de ma thag pa ni 'di yin te / sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gag pa de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Here, immediately after that,

original: 'gag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam /
translated: if the cessation of the collection of mind and mental factors is asserted to be the condition of the immediately preceding condition, it is illogical for that to be the condition of the arising of the collection because it has ceased, like consciousness that has ceased a long time ago.

original: gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Like form.

original: de la ni /
analyzed: de la ni /
translated: In that regard,

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it has ceased, what would be the condition?

original: de ni rkyen du mi srid pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni rkyen du mi srid pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is simply not possible that it is a condition,

original: 'gags pas ni dngos po skye bar 'dod pa la phan 'dogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gags pas ni dngos po skye bar 'dod pa la phan 'dogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because that which has ceased is not able to assist the arising of a thing.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin pa dang / spyi'i rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes dgag pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin pa dang / spyi'i rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes dgag pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of including the negation that it is not a condition in general and it is not a condition that is merely sequential.

original: ci ste rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gag bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas @60b phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / gal te de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du mchod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gag bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas @60b phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / gal te de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du mchod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if a thing is now arising through the power of individual conditions, since it is now ceasing, it assists by making room for it, and if it is established as a condition that is merely sequential because it is obstructed by other past moments, there is no error.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: And because the formless are not located in a place, they are not suitable as objects.üîΩThe consciousness that has just ceased

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid de //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid de //
translated: is the mental faculty.

original: zhes bya bas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the immediately preceding mind is the condition, and so your response is not appropriate.

original: 'gag bzhin pa rkyen nyid du rtog na yang kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa rkyen nyid du rtog na yang kha cig na re /
translated: If you imagine that the ceasing is the condition,

original: dus mnyam pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo zhe'o //
translated: some say that it is not suitable as the immediately preceding condition because it is simultaneous.

original: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma /
translated: Others say that the second half of this verseüîΩTherefore, the immediately preceding

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: is not logical.

original: 'gags na rkyen kyang gang zhig yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen kyang gang zhig yin // zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la yang bya ste /
translated: When it has ceased, what is the condition?üîΩis also applied to the unborn.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma skyes pa la ltos par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma skyes pa la ltos par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word also in this verse should be seen as referring to the unborn.

original: sa bon dang myu gu zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa gnyis ni med pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu 'gags pa dang skye ba gnyis rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa gnyis ni med pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu 'gags pa dang skye ba gnyis rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
translated: Because the seed and sprout are not both destroyed and not arisen, it follows that the seed and sprout would arise and cease without a cause.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: gal te don de 'dod na 'gags pa'i 'gag pa la rgyu med pas rnam par mi gnas pa de las skye bar 'dod pa skye bar rtog na 'gag pa dang skye ba gnyis la rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te don de 'dod na 'gags pa'i 'gag pa la rgyu med pas rnam par mi gnas pa de las skye bar 'dod pa skye bar rtog na 'gag pa dang skye ba gnyis la rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: because if you accept that meaning, then since the cessation of cessation would be causeless, it would not be tenable that it arises from that which is not enduring. If you imagine that arising arises from that, then both cessation and arising would be causeless.

original: bzlog pa las ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: bzlog pa las ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: But if you reverse that, then the error stated previously does not occur.

original: de'i tshe glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At that time, since the meaning of the words of the reversed probandum and proof are clearly stated, what is the point of using a statement that is open to dispute?

original: 'gags pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
translated: That which has ceased is not a condition,

original: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a cause.

original: skye ba yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs ma zhig pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs ma zhig pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: And arising is the cause of the collection of mind and mental factors not disintegrating.

original: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a cause.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: snga ma la ni gtan tshigs mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma la ni gtan tshigs mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the former case, the reason is not established.

original: phyi ma la ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi ma la ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: In the latter case, it contradicts the opponent‚Äôs position,

original: thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar na tshigs su bcad pa des kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen bstsal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
analyzed: thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro // de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa des kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen bstsal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
translated: because arising from everything is refuted.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because that verse refutes the condition of immediate antecedence, the reason is faulty in that it does not establish its meaning or it contradicts its meaning.

original: de ltar de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang dpyad zin to //
translated: Thus we have analyzed the condition of immediate antecedence.

original: da ni bdag po'i rkyen gyi skabs su bab pas de dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni bdag po'i rkyen gyi skabs su bab pas de dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Now it is the turn of the dominant condition, so let us analyze that.

original: khyed ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de bdag por 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de bdag por 'dod do //
translated: You assert that whatever exists and from which something arises is its dominant condition.

original: 'dir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni don dam par skye ba med par bstan pas dngos po rnams rang gi bdag nyid ma thob cing /
analyzed: 'dir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni don dam par skye ba med par bstan pas dngos po rnams rang gi bdag nyid ma thob cing /
translated: Here, in our own system, since it is taught that ultimately there is no arising, entities do not obtain their own intrinsic reality.

original: sgyu ma @61a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma @61a * //
translated: Like an illusion,üîΩthey are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de'i phyir 'di ltar /
analyzed: bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de'i phyir 'di ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is like this:

original: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi //üîΩyod pa gang phyir yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi // yod pa gang phyir yod min na //
translated: Since entities that lack intrinsic realityüîΩdo not exist,

original: yod pa nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: how could they exist?

original: don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: don dam pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only in the ultimate,

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang ste /
translated: but also in the conventional,

original: rgyu nyi tshe yod du zin kyang 'bras bu skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu nyi tshe yod du zin kyang 'bras bu skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: since it is accepted that even if a cause exists only a little, the effect arises.

original: 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes //
analyzed: 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that arises‚Äù

original: bya ba de ni 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba de ni 'thad ma yin //
translated: is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir khyed la gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed la gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the fault of your reason will follow.

original: gang dag de dag yod par ston pa na kun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag de dag yod par ston pa na kun rdzob tu de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are taught to exist because they are accepted as such conventionally, like the statement, ‚ÄúNirvana is peace,‚Äù

original: de dag gi dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no //
translated: then the fault in your example is the same as before.

original: 'dus byas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa las 'dun pa bzlog nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa las 'dun pa bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned people away from the desire for the conditioned, which is flawed by such faults as impermanence,

original: de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: in order to make them aspire to it, nirvana is taught to be peace, and this is included within conventional truth.

original: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist ultimately.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas /
translated: The Lord Buddha also said:

original: gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la mos pa rnams yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad pa yang tha snyad kyi bden pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la mos pa rnams yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad pa yang tha snyad kyi bden pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to console those disciples who are devoted to the profound Dharma, he praises nirvana with such qualities as peace, but this is only by accepting conventional truth.

original: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: In the ultimate, nirvana is also empty of the entityness of existence, etc., so the example does not exist. Therefore the reason is not established.

original: de med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since that is not established, the intended meaning is not established.

original: de ltar rkyen nyid bkag tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen nyid bkag tu zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although the conditions have been refuted,

original: yang gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: others still object, saying,

original: don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mchad dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mchad dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the ultimate, the conditions that establish the internal bases such as the eyes definitely exist,

original: de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because their effects arise, just like the conditions that establish a sprout, such as the seed.‚Äù

original: gang med pa de la ni rkyen yang med de /
analyzed: gang med pa de la ni rkyen yang med de /
translated: But if it does not exist, then it has no conditions.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the cloth of a turtle‚Äôs hair.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /üîΩci khyed kyi rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod dam /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste / ci khyed kyi rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod dam /
translated: You should ask them this:

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Do the individual conditions and the assembly of conditions exist or not exist in the nature of the effect?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te yod na phyogs de'i lan ni /
analyzed: gal te yod na phyogs de'i lan ni /
translated: If they exist, then the response to that position is:

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what is the use of conditions?

original: zhes lan btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan btab zin to //
translated: This response has already been given.

original: ji ste med na de'i lan yang //
analyzed: ji ste med na de'i lan yang //
translated: But if they do not exist, then the response to that is:

original: med na gang gis rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gis rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If they do not exist, what would be a condition?

original: zhes lan btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan btab zin to //
translated: This response has already been given.

original: 'on @61b kyang yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on @61b kyang yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: But still, we will explain this.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When

original: rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa la //
analyzed: rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa la //
translated: the effect does not exist in the assembly of conditions,

original: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //üîΩde'i tshe / rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid // de'i tshe / rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
translated: then the effect does not exist.üîΩAt that time,üîΩhow could that which does not exist in the conditions

original: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //
analyzed: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //
translated: arise from conditions?

original: don dam par 'bras bu skye ba med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu skye ba med pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, the effect does not arise at all.

original: rkyen rnams la med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rkyen rnams la med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that it does not exist in conditions.

original: rgyu spun dag las zho ji ltar 'byung ste de dag la zho med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ste 'bras bu la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa med bzhin du yang skye ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa byis pa'i blo can spyi'i spyod yul du gyur pa mthong nas don dam par yang mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched
analyzed: rgyu spun dag las zho ji ltar 'byung ste de dag la zho med pa'i phyir ro // ji ste 'bras bu la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa med bzhin du yang skye ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa byis pa'i blo can spyi'i spyod yul du gyur pa mthong nas don dam par yang mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched
translated: How could curd arise from a pair of causes, since curd does not exist in them?

original: rnams skye bar 'dod do zhe na de'i phyir bshad pa ;üîΩji ste de ni med par yang //
analyzed: rnams skye bar 'dod do zhe na de'i phyir bshad pa ; ji ste de ni med par yang //
translated: But if you see that a sprout and so on arises from a seed and so on, even though it does not exist, as a factor of conventional reality, within the domain of the understanding of the childish, then you assert that ultimately the internal bases such as the eyes arise from their own causes.üîΩIf it arises from those conditions

original: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
translated: Even though it does not exist,

original: 'o na lta /üîΩrkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: 'o na lta / rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
translated: then why

original: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur //üîΩdes na 'di la glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu med pa mi skye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur // des na 'di la glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu med pa mi skye ba bzhin du /
translated: Does it not arise from nonconditions?

original: rkyen rnams las kyang mi skye bar nges te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams las kyang mi skye bar nges te /
translated: Therefore, since this is a statement that is open to dispute, just as an effect that does not exist does not arise from nonconditions, it is certain that it also does not arise from conditions.

original: dper na gal te sgra byas pa rtag na bum pa byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩde skad smras na sgra ni mi rtag ste //
analyzed: dper na gal te sgra byas pa rtag na bum pa byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba lta bu'o // de skad smras na sgra ni mi rtag ste //
translated: For example, if sound were permanent because it is produced, then why is a pot not permanent?

original: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don de rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don de rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says this, the meaning of ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot‚Äù is understood.

original: des na 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par myu gus stong pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa las de skye bar mi 'thad de ;
analyzed: des na 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par myu gus stong pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa las de skye bar mi 'thad de ;
translated: Therefore, here the statement of the syllogism is: ‚ÄúUltimately, it is not tenable that a sprout arises from a seed that is empty of a sprout,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na zho bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na zho bzhin no //
translated: because it is an effect, like yogurt.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault stated does not apply.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho nar bzung ste /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho nar bzung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúUltimately, the conditions of internal things are only existent,

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de dag las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de dag las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they arise from them, like a pot.‚Äù This means ‚Äúbecause they arise from them.‚Äù

original: gyur pa la byung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa ni 'jim pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gyur pa la byung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa ni 'jim pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: because that which is produced is called ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe pot is arisen from clay.‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩ'bras bu rkyen las byung yin na //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / 'bras bu rkyen las byung yin na //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf the effect arises from conditions,

original: rkyen las gyur pa yin na'o //
analyzed: rkyen las gyur pa yin na'o //
translated: then it arises from conditions.

original: rkyen rnams rang las byung ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen rnams rang las byung ma yin //
translated: Conditions do not arise from themselves.

original: rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúConditions do not arise from themselves‚Äù is that they do not arise from their own entities.

original: ngo bo nyid la byung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i snying ni mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la byung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i snying ni mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because that which arises from itself is called ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe heart of the brahmin is arisen from butter.‚ÄùüîΩAs for why conditions do not arise from their own entities, this has been explained earlier.

original: rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pa de'i phyir /üîΩrang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
