analyzed: rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pa de'i phyir / rang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
translated: Therefore we say:üîΩHow could an effect arise

original: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung //üîΩdon dam par 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba @62a * //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung // don dam par 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba @62a * //
translated: from conditions that do not arise from themselves?

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe effect does not arise from conditions ultimately‚Äù is the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe effect does not arise from conditions.‚Äù

original: dper na gal te ba r'a ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin na bha ba ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na gal te ba r'a ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin na bha ba ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, if Bharata the younger was celibate, how could he be the son of Bharata the elder?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i 'jim pa'i gong bu de'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa las skyes pa'i bum pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis tha snyad du yang /üîΩde las gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par mi bzod pas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i 'jim pa'i gong bu de'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa las skyes pa'i bum pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis tha snyad du yang / de las gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par mi bzod pas /
translated: A pot that is produced from a lump of clay that is empty of intrinsic reality is not something that the wise can accept even conventionally as being produced from that.

original: de phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the effect is produced from conditions.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not produced from conditions.

original: des na dpe med de /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: des na dpe med de / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, the example does not exist.

original: don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the property to be established and the sign are incomplete, as before, the meaning of the reason is not established or the meaning is contradictory.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis sun phyung ba'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis sun phyung ba'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
translated: Here, after superimposing the meaning of the refutation by the other, it is said:

original: gal te 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba med pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba med pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
translated: But even if you say that because the effect does not arise from conditions, it is taught that there is no inference,

original: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor bas de ma bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor bas de ma bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang brjod par nus te /
translated: since the effect does not abandon its own nature, it can be expressed by another, because it is not refuted.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, the conditions of the internal sense sources exist,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are effects, like a sprout and so on.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: An effect that arises from nonconditionsüîΩdoes not exist.

original: yod min / rkyen ma yin pa las gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni tha snyad du yang rtogs par mi nus na /
analyzed: yod min / rkyen ma yin pa las gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni tha snyad du yang rtogs par mi nus na /
translated: If an effect that arises from nonconditions cannot be conceived even conventionally,

original: don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention its existence in reality?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here you say:

original: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: If in reality conditions are empty of the entity of conditions,

original: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa grub pas 'dod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa grub pas 'dod pa 'grub bo //
translated: But if you maintain that conditions are not empty of the intrinsic reality of nonconditions, then nonconditions are established and your thesis is refuted.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
translated: We teach that nonconditions are merely the negation of the intrinsic reality of conditions.

original: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi ston to //
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi ston to //
translated: We do not teach that nonconditions have the intrinsic reality of nonconditions, because we accept the meaning of a negation as an absence.

original: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba byas nas rkyen min zhes bya ba dang / rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba byas nas rkyen min zhes bya ba dang / rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: Having made this distinction, we explain that nonconditions are not conditions and how could they be conditions?

original: rkyen ma yin pa rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that nonconditions do not have the intrinsic reality of conditions.

original: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa skye ba bstsal pas /
analyzed: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu yod pa dang / med pa skye ba bstsal pas /
translated: Or, since you have accepted the production of an existent or nonexistent effect in the manner already explained,

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na //
translated: then because the effect does not exist,

original: rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could a non-condition be a condition?

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i rkyen 'thad pa med pa rnams rkyen du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i rkyen 'thad pa med pa rnams rkyen du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could those which are not tenable as conditions that are not of the nature of conditions be conditions?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no @62b zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no @62b zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: It is definitely not so. This is the meaning of the words.

original: de'i blo dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan can de dag gi 'bras bu med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i blo dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan can de dag gi 'bras bu med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that the cognition and term of those are applied to that which is the mere cause of the appearance of those, because they are the mere effect of that.

original: 'dir / rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: 'dir / rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
translated: Here, the meaning of the text beginning with ‚ÄúThere are four conditions: causal,

original: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
translated: objective, immediately preceding, and dominant,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba man chad gzhan gyis smras pa'i rkyen rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag bstsal ba'i dbang gis de mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba man chad gzhan gyis smras pa'i rkyen rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag bstsal ba'i dbang gis de mjug bsdus te /
translated: is summarized by the power of refuting the nature and distinctions of the conditions spoken of by others.

original: 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni skye ba med pa bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni skye ba med pa bstan pa yin pas /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is the teaching of non-arising.

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa'i khung /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa'i khung /
translated: Therefore, the reason for the non-arising of dependent origination

original: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
translated: is stated in the lines ‚ÄúWhatever arises from conditions does not arise.‚Äù

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med //
translated: There is no intrinsically real arising.

original: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsungs //
translated: That which depends on conditions is said to be empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes te bag yod yin //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes te bag yod yin //
translated: One who knows emptiness is heedful.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gang la cung zad skye med cing //
analyzed: gang la cung zad skye med cing //
translated: Where there is no arising whatsoever

original: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //
translated: And no cessation whatsoever,

original: 'gro ba dben mthong de la ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba dben mthong de la ni //
translated: Seeing beings as void,

original: yod pa nyid dang med nyid med //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med nyid med //
translated: There is neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is a permanent, nonarising phenomenon.

original: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jam dpal de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jam dpal de'i phyir /
translated: And similarly, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,

original: khyod kyis rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: by this explanation you should know that

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du gang du sred pa thams cad 'gag pa de ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du gang du sred pa thams cad 'gag pa de ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arising‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-cessation‚Äù are terms that refer to the TathƒÅgata.üîΩAnd similarly, ‚Äúwhere all craving ceases, there is no arising.‚Äù

original: gang skye ba med pa de ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa de ni byang chub bo //
translated: And ‚Äúwhere there is no arising, that is awakening.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten ni skye ba la mngon par zhe na te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni skye ba la mngon par zhe na te /
translated: The world is attached to arising.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: Here, there is no arising of a buddha,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /üîΩgang gis phung po skye med cing //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du / gang gis phung po skye med cing //
translated: and there is no nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚ÄùüîΩAnd similarly, ‚ÄúThose who know that the aggregates are non-arisen

original: 'byung ba med par yongs shes pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba med par yongs shes pa //
translated: and do not occur

original: de dag 'jig rten spyod 'gyur yang //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten spyod 'gyur yang //
translated: are active in the world

original: 'jig rten 'di na gnas pa min //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na gnas pa min //
translated: but do not abide in this world.‚ÄùüîΩAnd so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: This is established.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter of the Root Verses of the Middle Way, called ‚ÄúExamination of the Prior Entity.‚Äù

original: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
analyzed: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Conditions.‚Äù

original: // / da ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan par byed pa'am /
analyzed: // / da ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan par byed pa'am /
translated: Now, in order to teach dependent origination as endowed with the distinction of being without coming and going,

original: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar byed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa @63a * //üîΩgnyis pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar byed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa @63a * // gnyis pa brtsam mo //
translated: or in order to eliminate the counter-argument that all things are without arising, which was presented in the first chapter, the second chapter is begun.

original: gzhan dag ni slob ma skye ba med pa'i rigs pa thob pas dad pa skyes pa 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag pa nyan 'dod pa'i don du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni slob ma skye ba med pa'i rigs pa thob pas dad pa skyes pa 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag pa nyan 'dod pa'i don du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Others say that the second chapter is begun for the sake of those disciples who, having gained the reasoning of non-arising, have developed faith, and who wish to listen to the refutation of coming and going that is renowned in the world.

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-Buddhists say that this is not correct,

original: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not reasonable for one whose mind has been distorted by the appearance of a valid means of knowledge to ask such a question.

original: de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that going exists, and in order to demonstrate that arising exists,

original: rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: it is fitting that you state a syllogism.

original: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems rmongs par gyur pa yang don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems rmongs par gyur pa yang don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar rigs te /
translated: But how could one whose mind is confused by the appearance of a valid cognition say, ‚ÄúUltimately, there is no going‚Äù?

original: 'dri ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dri ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a question that accords with reason.

original: mi shes pa'i 'dri ba yin par brtags na ni bstan bcos phal pa'i spyod yul yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i 'dri ba yin par brtags na ni bstan bcos phal pa'i spyod yul yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: If it is considered to be a question that is asked out of ignorance, then it would be the domain of ordinary treatises.

original: 'jig rten na ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bstsal na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bstsal na /
translated: In the world, for the most part, people are attached to the reality of action on the basis of the conventions of many actions. In order to remove the pain of that attachment, if one action that has the characteristic of going is stated,

original: bya ba lhag ma dag bstsal pa yang sla bas /
analyzed: bya ba lhag ma dag bstsal pa yang sla bas /
translated: then it is easy to state the remaining actions.

original: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs position is stated.

original: 'di la skabs kyi don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste /
analyzed: 'di la skabs kyi don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste /
translated: Here, the opponent‚Äôs position is presented in the following:

original: nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: Internal things are only produced,

original: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are designated as objects.

original: 'di la gang mi skye ba ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di la gang mi skye ba ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad mi byed de /
translated: Here, that which is not produced is not designated as an object,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu 'gro bar mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu 'gro bar mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the son of a barren woman does not go.

original: lhas byin dang khyab 'jug bshes gnyen ni de ltar 'gro bar byed pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: lhas byin dang khyab 'jug bshes gnyen ni de ltar 'gro bar byed pa ma yin pas /
translated: Devadatta and Vi·π£·πáu do not go in that way.

original: de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin no ;
translated: Therefore, internal things are only produced.

original: / phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa bstsal ba'i phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: / phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa bstsal ba'i phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: This is explained in order to refute the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gal te sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgrub par gyur pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgrub par gyur pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If the production, going, and coming of the practice of generosity, morality, concentration, and so on, which are renowned in the world, are established, then the practice is established.

original: 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba'i skye ba dang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba'i skye ba dang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: But if you prove that in the ultimate sense, the yogi who is equipoised sees with the eye of wisdom the reality of things just as it is, and that birth, going, and coming exist, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'gro ba yang skye ba dgag pa kho na bzhin du dgag @63b pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang skye ba dgag pa kho na bzhin du dgag @63b pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because going is refuted just like the refutation of arising, going is refuted.

original: spyi'i rnam pa gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa gtan tshigs su rtogs na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la de rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa gtan tshigs su rtogs na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la de rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: And if you understand the reason to be a general characteristic of both positions, then because there is no pervasion and because it pervades only the discordant position, the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is said:üîΩIf going existed in the ultimate sense, then it would be where one has gone, where one has not gone,

original: 'di la gal te don dam par 'gro ba yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la gal te don dam par 'gro ba yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am /
translated: or where one goes.

original: bsgom pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bsgom pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If you say that it exists in that being gone over,

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: then in that case,

original: re zhig song la 'gro med de //
analyzed: re zhig song la 'gro med de //
translated: There is no going where one has gone,

original: de la 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of going has already ceased there.

original: don de ni gzhan dag la yang grags pas bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don de ni gzhan dag la yang grags pas bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: This point is well known to others, so it need not be established.

original: de smos pa ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de smos pa ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: He mentions it because he accepts it as an example that is accepted by others.

original: / de'i chos ni lam nyid yin la /
analyzed: / de'i chos ni lam nyid yin la /
translated: The path is the property of that.

original: ma song ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: ma song ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas /
translated: And it is the same with where one has not gone.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
translated: There is no going where one has not gone.

original: lam yin pa'i phyir song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it is the path, like the path where one has gone.

original: yang na ma song ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa ste de'i chos ni ma song ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na ma song ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa ste de'i chos ni ma song ba nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, where one has not gone is where the action of going has not yet begun. Its property is that it is where one has not gone.

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te //
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te //
translated: The example is in terms of the property of the probandum and the property of the proof.

original: gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no //
translated: The path is the property possessor that has the property that is accepted by both parties, but it is not accepted as the place where one goes.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni ma song ba la 'gro ba med de ma song ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni ma song ba la 'gro ba med de ma song ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no //
translated: Here, the inference is: There is no going where one has not yet gone, because it is where one has not yet gone, like the path that is not asserted to be where one has gone.

original: 'di la 'ug pa pa dag na re /
analyzed: 'di la 'ug pa pa dag na re /
translated: Here, the owls say:

original: ci ma song ba de la lhas byin 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston tam /
analyzed: ci ma song ba de la lhas byin 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston tam /
translated: Is it taught that where one has not yet gone, Lhejin has no going because the activity of going has not yet arisen?

original: 'on te 'gro ba'i bya ba skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba'i bya ba skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston /
translated: Or is it taught that where one has not yet gone, Lhejin has no going because the activity of going has arisen?

original: des ci ra 'gyur /
analyzed: des ci ra 'gyur /
translated: What is the problem?

original: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you assert the former, it is an argument that establishes what is already established.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if you assert the latter, then the meaning of the reason is contradictory. Therefore, the meaning of the previous reason is not that it is not established.

original: gal te rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ma grub pas de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ma grub pas de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not correct because going that is different from the goer is not established, then that is not so.

original: lhas byin 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i blo gros kyi yul ni lhas byin gyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i blo gros kyi yul ni lhas byin gyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The object of the cognition ‚ÄúDevadatta is going‚Äù is the meaning of the word ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù as possessing going.

original: des pa skye ba'i phyir dper na lhas byin dbyug pa dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i blo gros kyi yul bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des pa skye ba'i phyir dper na lhas byin dbyug pa dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i blo gros kyi yul bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is produced, like the object of the cognition ‚ÄúDevadatta is holding a stick.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir gal te lhas byin khyad par gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa la blo gros kyi yul nyid lhas byin gyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin par ston na ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te lhas byin khyad par gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa la blo gros kyi yul nyid lhas byin gyi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin par ston na ni /
translated: Here, if it is shown that the object of the cognition ‚ÄúDevadatta is endowed with some particular quality‚Äù is the meaning of the word ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù as possessing something other than Devadatta‚Äôs own self,

original: tha @64a * //
analyzed: tha @64a * //
translated: then it is established as a proof

original: snyad du sgrub pa la bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: snyad du sgrub pa la bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: because it is established by conventional acknowledgment,

original: 'di ltar lhas byin zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa la 'di 'gro ba dang ldan no snyam pa'i blo gros 'di khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhas byin zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa la 'di 'gro ba dang ldan no snyam pa'i blo gros 'di khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in this way, the cognition ‚ÄúDevadatta is going‚Äù is accepted as the cognition ‚ÄúThis one is going‚Äù in regard to the collection of aggregates called ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù as possessing the particular quality of the characteristic of being born in another place.

original: ji ste lhas byin 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin no zhe na ni dpe med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste lhas byin 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa yin no zhe na ni dpe med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the meaning of the words ‚ÄúDevadatta goes‚Äù that is the referent, then there is no example.

original: ji ste gzhan du na yang tha snyad du yang don 'gal ba nyid yin na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan du na yang tha snyad du yang don 'gal ba nyid yin na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If it is the referent itself that is contradictory, then what need is there to speak of the ultimate?

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the fault that we have stated cannot be averted.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig na re /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig na re /
translated: Some of our own schools say:

original: 'dun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsol bas bskyed pa'i rlung gi khams las 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs lus zhes bya ba yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba byung ba las 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsol bas bskyed pa'i rlung gi khams las 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs lus zhes bya ba yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba byung ba las 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of the primary elements and the derivative form called ‚Äúbody‚Äù arises from the primary wind element, which is generated by the effort that arises from the cause of aspiration, and it arises in another place without interruption. Because of that, it is called ‚Äúgoing.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur pa med de /
translated: Therefore, going is not a different object.

original: skye ba'i yul nyid du skye bar byed pa 'jig pa'i phyir me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin pas 'gro ba don gzhan du khas mi len to ;
analyzed: skye ba'i yul nyid du skye bar byed pa 'jig pa'i phyir me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin pas 'gro ba don gzhan du khas mi len to ;
translated: Because it is destroyed in the very place where it arises, like a flame, going is a delusion. Therefore, we do not accept that going is a different object.

original: / don dam par yang 'gro ba med pas don dam par yang 'gro ba 'gog pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / don dam par yang 'gro ba med pas don dam par yang 'gro ba 'gog pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since there is no going even in the ultimate, the refutation of going in the ultimate is an establishment of what is already established.

original: skye ba bkag pas ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa de yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin pa yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang skye bo mkhas pa'i yid mgu bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pas ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa de yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin pa yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang skye bo mkhas pa'i yid mgu bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the refutation of arising does not establish what you have said, and since the cognition that going is a delusion, like a flame, is itself a delusion, and since it also refutes the nondifference of the goer and going, this is not pleasing to the wise.

original: grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say:

original: ma song ba la rdul shas che zhing bya ba byed pa la 'jug pa gsal bar gyur pa na 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma song ba la rdul shas che zhing bya ba byed pa la 'jug pa gsal bar gyur pa na 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
translated: When the action of going is clearly engaged, then it is said that one goes.

original: de dag gi yang gsal ba bkag pa'i phyir 'gro ba mi 'grub pas rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi yang gsal ba bkag pa'i phyir 'gro ba mi 'grub pas rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: But since the refutation of the manifest is established, going is not established. Therefore, this is mere speculation.

original: ci ste yang 'gro ba smra ba dag ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas bsgom pa la 'gro ba yod par dam bcas na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'gro ba smra ba dag ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas bsgom pa la 'gro ba yod par dam bcas na /
translated: But if the proponents of going say that, fearing the previously mentioned errors, they do not assert that going exists in that being gone over,üîΩthen the master, having ascertained the meaning of that, explains that since neither that being gone over nor that not yet gone over exists,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med do snyam na slob dpon gyis don de nges par mdzad nas song ba dang / ma song ba dag dang gtogs par bgom pa med pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med do snyam na slob dpon gyis don de nges par mdzad nas song ba dang / ma song ba dag dang gtogs par bgom pa med pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: the error mentioned previously does not arise:

original: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from that gone over and that not yet gone over,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: going is not apprehended.

original: gzung du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is impossible to apprehend it.

original: ji ltar de med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de med ce na /
translated: How is it impossible?

original: 'di la bgom pa de na song ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la bgom pa de na song ba'am /
translated: Here, apart from that being gone over,

original: ma song ba'am gang cung zad song dang ma song ba gnyi ga zhig yin grang na @64b phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma song ba'am gang cung zad song dang ma song ba gnyi ga zhig yin grang na @64b phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is either where one has gone or where one has not gone, or where one is going, then it is undermined by the reductio that applies to both positions.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: bgom pa med pa ma yin te //üîΩ'di ltar / gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
analyzed: bgom pa med pa ma yin te // 'di ltar / gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
translated: The path over which one is going does not exist.üîΩBut it is said:üîΩWhere there is movement, there is going.

original: de yang gang gis bgom pa la //
analyzed: de yang gang gis bgom pa la //
translated: And that movement is seen on the path over which one is going.

original: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
analyzed: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
translated: That movement is seen on the path over which one is going, but it is not seen on the path over which one has gone nor on the path over which one has not gone.

original: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
analyzed: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
translated: Therefore, going exists on the path over which one is going.

original: de la phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba de na 'gro ba yod de /üîΩg-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang /
analyzed: de la phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba de na 'gro ba yod de / g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang /
translated: In this regard, where there is movement characterized by the raising and lowering of the foot, there going is seen.

original: ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: And that movement is seen on the path over which one is going, but that movement is not seen on the path over which one has gone nor on the path over which one has not gone.üîΩTherefore, going exists on the path over which one is going.

original: des na de ltar bgom pa yod pas 'gro ba 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub bo //
analyzed: des na de ltar bgom pa yod pas 'gro ba 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub bo //
translated: Thus, since the path over which one is going exists, going is established. Therefore, our assertion is established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad smras pa'i tshul gyis na bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad smras pa'i tshul gyis na bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that ‚Äúgoing‚Äù is not known in the manner described.

original: gang yin pa de rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang yin pa de rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That is illogical.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: And it is also not undermined by the reductio argument presented in both of the two theses.

original: gzhan dag ni gang gi zhes bya ba 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro //üîΩkha cig na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang gi zhes bya ba 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro // kha cig na re /
translated: Others say that ‚Äúhis‚Äù refers to the goer.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say that is illogical.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra'i zla med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba'i gzhi 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dang / song ba dang ma song ba'i 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra'i zla med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba'i gzhi 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dang / song ba dang ma song ba'i 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù has no antecedent, because the basis of action is not confused, and because it demonstrates the refutation of the goer‚Äôs going where he has gone and where he has not gone.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩbgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
translated: Here we say:üîΩHow could it be tenable

original: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: That going exists where one is going?

original: gang gi tshe dmigs kyis bsal ba dang / ma bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid khas blangs su zin kyang de la 'gro ba yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs kyis bsal ba dang / ma bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid khas blangs su zin kyang de la 'gro ba yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: Even though you accept that the nature of that which is being gone over is both that which is traversed and that which is not yet traversed, going there is not tenable.

original: lam yin pa'i phyir dper na song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir dper na song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it is the path, like a path that has been traversed.

original: yang na / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
analyzed: yang na / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
translated: Again,

original: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: How could going existüîΩOn that being gone over?

original: zhes bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: This is because the analysis is the same.

original: bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par brtag na brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa 'dir 'gyur te /üîΩg-yo ba song ba'am /
analyzed: bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par brtag na brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa 'dir 'gyur te / g-yo ba song ba'am /
translated: If you imagine that going exists on that being gone over, this analysis is the same.üîΩIs the movement of going on that being gone over,

original: ma song ba'am /
analyzed: ma song ba'am /
translated: or on that not yet gone over,

original: de gnyis dang mi 'dra ba'i chos gang la yod ce na /
analyzed: de gnyis dang mi 'dra ba'i chos gang la yod ce na /
translated: or on that not similar to both?

original: de la yang skyon bshad zin to //üîΩyang na / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni ;
analyzed: de la yang skyon bshad zin to // yang na / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni ;
translated: The error in that has already been explained.üîΩAgain,üîΩHow could going exist

original: / ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: / ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: On that being gone over?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: don dam pa'i 'gro ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩgang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
analyzed: don dam pa'i 'gro ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir / gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
translated: there is no inference that demonstrates that ultimate going exists.üîΩWhen there is no goingüîΩOn that being gone over,üîΩon that not yet gone over,üîΩor on that being gone over,

original: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
translated: where could going exist?

original: rta bcing ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar yang dgongs te /
analyzed: rta bcing ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar yang dgongs te /
translated: Because it is consistent with the binding of a horse.

original: 'di la ji ltar rta bcing ba dang mthun pa @65a * //
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar rta bcing ba dang mthun pa @65a * //
translated: How is it consistent with the binding of a horse?üîΩWhere there is going,

original: nyid yin zhe na /üîΩbgom pa gang yin /üîΩg-yo ba gang na ba'o //
analyzed: nyid yin zhe na / bgom pa gang yin / g-yo ba gang na ba'o //
translated: there is movement.üîΩWhere there is movement,

original: g-yo ba gang na /
analyzed: g-yo ba gang na /
translated: there is going.

original: bgom pa na'o zhes bya bas gang yang rung ba dmigs kyis ma bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa na'o zhes bya bas gang yang rung ba dmigs kyis ma bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not specified which is the case,

original: ci ste thog ma med pa nas tha snyad du grags pa'i bgom pa khas blangs nas de la don dam pa ba'i 'gro ba yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste thog ma med pa nas tha snyad du grags pa'i bgom pa khas blangs nas de la don dam pa ba'i 'gro ba yod par 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that which is being gone over that is renowned in conventional terms from beginningless time, and assert that it has ultimate going,

original: de lta na yang 'di la 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig pu zhig yod pa de ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar ba'i mthu can yin pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba'i 'gro ba gzhan de gang zhig yod /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di la 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig pu zhig yod pa de ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar ba'i mthu can yin pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba'i 'gro ba gzhan de gang zhig yod /
translated: then in that case, since there is only one action of going, and it is powerful in being applied to that which is called that being gone over, then what other going is there that is called ‚Äúgoing where there is going‚Äù?

original: de la pha rol pos nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la pha rol pos nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: In response to that, the opponent might say that internal things are only produced.

original: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub ste /
translated: But that is not established.üîΩ

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not established, because the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dpe yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: dpe yang ma grub ste /
translated: The example is also not established,

original: don dam par lhas byin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately Devadatta is not established.

original: ci ste 'gro ba'i bya ba ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin la /üîΩ'di ltar de ni kho bo cag 'gro ba'i sgrar brjod pas des na de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro ba'i bya ba ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin la / 'di ltar de ni kho bo cag 'gro ba'i sgrar brjod pas des na de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúThe activity of going is not complete in what is called the path being gone over,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because we say that the word ‚Äògoing‚Äô refers to that, and therefore the meaning of the reason is not not established,‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgang gis bgom la 'gro yod pa //üîΩde yi bgom la 'gro med par //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang gis bgom la 'gro yod pa // de yi bgom la 'gro med par //
translated: in response to that it is said:üîΩIf going exists on that being gone over,

original: thal bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
translated: then it follows that going would not exist on that being gone over,

original: bgom pa khong du chud phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa khong du chud phyir ro //
translated: because going is understood in dependence on that being gone over.

original: smras pa gang gi bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa de'i phyogs la 'gro ba la 'gro ba yod kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa gang gi bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa de'i phyogs la 'gro ba la 'gro ba yod kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: In the context where going exists on that being gone over, going exists on that which is being gone over, but it follows that going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba /üîΩde la 'gro ba'i byed pa yongs su ma rdzogs shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba / de la 'gro ba'i byed pa yongs su ma rdzogs shing /
translated: Because that which is called ‚Äúthat being gone over‚ÄùüîΩis understood and known as that on which the action of going is not complete,

original: ma zhugs par khong du chud cing shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhugs par khong du chud cing shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and that on which it has not yet begun.

original: de ni mi 'dod de bgom pa zhes bya ba de 'gro ba dang bcas par 'dod pas des na 'gro ba'i byed pas de la don byas zin pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan mi 'thad pas ji skad bshad pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de bgom pa zhes bya ba de 'gro ba dang bcas par 'dod pas des na 'gro ba'i byed pas de la don byas zin pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan mi 'thad pas ji skad bshad pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it is asserted that that called ‚Äúthat being gone over‚Äù possesses going. Therefore, since the action of going has already performed its function on that, it is untenable that there is another going. Thus the previously explained error cannot be averted.

original: ci ste ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi nyen yongs su spang bar 'dod pas bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan par 'dod cing /
analyzed: ci ste ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi nyen yongs su spang bar 'dod pas bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan par 'dod cing /
translated: But if you assert that that being gone over possesses going in order to completely avoid the error just explained,

original: 'gro ba nyid 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba nyid 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
translated: and going itself is going,

original: de lta na yang ;
analyzed: de lta na yang ;
translated: then in that case

original: bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
analyzed: bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
translated: If going exists on that being gone over,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //üîΩgang gis bgom pa de dang ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te // gang gis bgom pa de dang ni //
translated: It follows that there would be two goings.üîΩBecause of the going by means of which

original: de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is being gone over is being gone over,üîΩand because of the going by means of which the conventional going exists on that which is being gone over.

original: don dam pa pa'i 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par rtog na ni 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par rtog na ni 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine that that which is being gone over, which possesses ultimate going, has going, then it follows that there would be two goings.

original: 'gro ba gang gis bgom pa de bgom pa @65b zhes bya bar gyur ba dang / 'gro ba gang gis bgom pa de la tha snyad pa'i 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang gis bgom pa de bgom pa @65b zhes bya bar gyur ba dang / 'gro ba gang gis bgom pa de la tha snyad pa'i 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Because of the going by means of which that which is being gone over is called ‚Äúthat which is being gone over,‚Äù and because of the going by means of which conventional going exists on that which is being gone over.

original: de ltar na /üîΩ'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
analyzed: de ltar na / 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
translated: In that case,üîΩit follows that there would be two goings,

original: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: and the goer would also be twofold.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
translated: Why?üîΩBecause without a goer,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: going is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi dri ma nges par bsal bar 'dod pas tha snyad pa'i 'gro ba gcig kho na khas len cing de la ltos pas 'gro ba po dang bgom pa 'grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi dri ma nges par bsal bar 'dod pas tha snyad pa'i 'gro ba gcig kho na khas len cing de la ltos pas 'gro ba po dang bgom pa 'grub tu zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to definitely remove the stains of the faults explained above should accept that there is only one kind of conventional going. In dependence on that, the goer and the path being gone over are established.

original: don dam pa pa'i 'gro ba yang mi 'thad pas de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba mi 'grub cing /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i 'gro ba yang mi 'thad pas de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba mi 'grub cing /
translated: However, since ultimate going is also untenable, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the conventions of the object of going and the goer exist‚Äù is not established, and since there is no example, it is not established that ‚Äúinternal things are only arisen.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa grub bo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore the distinction that dependent origination is without coming and without going is established.

original: sgra pa dag na re 'gro ba ni gcig tu zad de /
analyzed: sgra pa dag na re 'gro ba ni gcig tu zad de /
translated: The Grammarians say: Going is exhausted as one.

original: de nyid kho bo cag rang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro bar brjod cing /
analyzed: de nyid kho bo cag rang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro bar brjod cing /
translated: We say that it is just that which is called going by virtue of its own nature.

original: de gzhi gang na yod pa de ni bgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de gzhi gang na yod pa de ni bgom pa yin la /
translated: That on which it is based is where one goes.

original: 'gro ba po gang yin pa de ni byed pa po yin pas de'i phyir 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba po gang yin pa de ni byed pa po yin pas de'i phyir 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: And since the goer is the agent, therefore it is not the case that the consequence of two goings and two goers would follow.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: don dam par 'gro ba'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / bgom pa med pas 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du skyes pa la 'gro ba po nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / bgom pa yang brtags zin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / bgom pa med pas 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du skyes pa la 'gro ba po nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / bgom pa yang brtags zin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because ultimately the arising of going has been refuted, because there is no going where one has gone and where one has not gone, because the mere collection of formations is designated as the goer when it arises in another place, and because where one goes has already been investigated.

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /üîΩbam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma / bam po gsum pa /
translated: Illuminating the Middle Way

original: gzhan dag na de 'gro ba yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na de 'gro ba yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: Others say: Going definitely exists,

original: de'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its basis exists.

original: 'di na gang la gzhi med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang la gzhi med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not have a basis does not exist.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i 'gyel ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i 'gyel ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the falling and going of the son of a barren woman.üîΩSince the goer, the basis of going, exists, going exists because the basis exists.

original: 'gro ba'i gzhi 'gro ba po de shar ma yod pas de ltar gzhi yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod pas gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gzhi 'gro ba po de shar ma yod pas de ltar gzhi yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod pas gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the reason is established.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho na yin zhing 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yang 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho na yin zhing 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yang 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: The internal sense spheres are only produced, and going, coming, and so on are also established.‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
translated: If the goer does not exist,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Going is not tenable.

original: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //üîΩyod pa nyid @66a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po // yod pa nyid @66a * //
translated: If going does not exist,

original: du ga la 'gyur //üîΩgtan tshigs brjod pa med na 'gro ba mi 'grub pas ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gro ba po med na 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: du ga la 'gyur // gtan tshigs brjod pa med na 'gro ba mi 'grub pas ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gro ba po med na 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: How could the goer exist?üîΩIf the reason is not stated, going is not established, so the previously explained error does not disappear.

original: 'gro ba'i gzhi 'gro ba po la brten nas gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs brjod par gyur na de lta na /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gzhi 'gro ba po la brten nas gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs brjod par gyur na de lta na /
translated: Thinking this, since if the goer does not exist, going does not exist, the reason is stated: ‚ÄúBecause the basis exists in dependence on the goer, the basis of going.‚Äù

original: gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
translated: But if the goer does not exist,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: then going is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But this is not so.

original: 'gro ba de yang mi 'thad do zhes dpyad zin to //
analyzed: 'gro ba de yang mi 'thad do zhes dpyad zin to //
translated: And it has been analyzed that going is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir / 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: Therefore, if going does not exist,

original: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could the goer exist?

original: 'gro ba po nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba po nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the goer would be without a cause.

original: ga la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid mi ches pa ste /
analyzed: ga la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid mi ches pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúhow‚Äù indicates disbelief,

original: 'gro ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: and the meaning of the statement is that the goer does not exist.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'gro ba po ma grub pas gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub nyid dam /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma grub pas gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub nyid dam /
translated: Since the goer is not established, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the basis exists‚Äù is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Or the meaning is contradictory.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩ'o na 'gro ba grub par bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan 'di nyon cig ;'gro ba yod pa kho nar nges te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'o na 'gro ba grub par bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan 'di nyon cig ;'gro ba yod pa kho nar nges te /
translated: Objection:

original: des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now listen to another argument for the establishment of going: Going definitely exists because the convention of possession of going exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa la ni des de dang ldan par mi ston te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa la ni des de dang ldan par mi ston te /
translated: But if something does not exist here, then it is not taught to be possessed by that.

original: dper na ri bong ra can zhes mi ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong ra can zhes mi ston pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not taught that a rabbit has horns.

original: lhas byin 'gro ba po zhes 'gro bas de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad 'di yod pas des na 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir bsams pa'i don 'grub bo //
analyzed: lhas byin 'gro ba po zhes 'gro bas de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad 'di yod pas des na 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir bsams pa'i don 'grub bo //
translated: Since the expression ‚ÄúDevadatta is a goer‚Äù exists, and since he is possessed of going, the intended meaning is established because going exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la lhas byin 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di don dam par 'gro ba po'i yin par 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'di la lhas byin 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di don dam par 'gro ba po'i yin par 'dod dam /
translated: In this regard, do you assert that the expression ‚ÄúDevadatta is a goer‚Äù refers to an ultimate goer?

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i yin par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it refers to a non-goer?

original: de la re zhig 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste /
translated: First, a goer does not go.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù indicates a sequence.

original: 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A goer does not go.

original: dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: bdag gi tshig tu bstan pa ni 'di ltar gang dag sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: bdag gi tshig tu bstan pa ni 'di ltar gang dag sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúMy words‚Äù indicates that some people follow mere words.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mi mkhas pa /
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mi mkhas pa /
translated: They are unskilled in discerning phenomena.

original: lta ba ngan pas blo gros nyams par gyur pa /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pas blo gros nyams par gyur pa /
translated: Their intelligence is impaired by bad views.

original: tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: They turn their backs on morality, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: rang yang lam gol bar zhugs shing /
analyzed: rang yang lam gol bar zhugs shing /
translated: They themselves have entered a false path.

original: gzhan dag kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang /
translated: And they cause others

original: gsang tshig sgra dang yig 'brus nyams gyur na //
analyzed: gsang tshig sgra dang yig 'brus nyams gyur na //
translated: To be ruined by secret words, sounds, and letters.

original: log par sbyar bas de yi don mi ston //
analyzed: log par sbyar bas de yi don mi ston //
translated: They do not teach the meaning of the tantras because of their wrong application.

original: rdo rje'i tshig des mchod sbyin byed brlag ste //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig des mchod sbyin byed brlag ste //
translated: The words of the vajra destroy the sacrifice,

original: dbang po'i dgra po sgra yis brlag pa bzhin //
analyzed: dbang po'i dgra po sgra yis brlag pa bzhin //
translated: Just as the enemy of the senses, sound, destroys it.üîΩAnd the asuras say, ‚ÄúHelƒÅ, helƒÅ,‚Äù which means ‚Äúovercome by poison.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba dang / lha ma yin de dag gis he la yo he la ya zhes smras pa @66b na za'i gyis non par gyur pa dang / mi bsgrub pa tshig zur chag smras nas tshig ldan ma'i sgrub mchod spyod sel can spyod par byed pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / lha ma yin de dag gis he la yo he la ya zhes smras pa @66b na za'i gyis non par gyur pa dang / mi bsgrub pa tshig zur chag smras nas tshig ldan ma'i sgrub mchod spyod sel can spyod par byed pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: They speak with broken words that cannot be understood.

original: sgra gcig legs par sbyar na yang legs pa byed pa rnams kyi 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'di skad ces gzhan gyi tshig can dang / bdag gi tshig can dang / gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi skad kyi byings nges par gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams ni rjes su smra ba kho nar zad pas bdag gi tshig can nyid kyi brdar gdags su mi rung ngo zhes zer bas der 'dzud par byed pa dag de la mngon par
analyzed: sgra gcig legs par sbyar na yang legs pa byed pa rnams kyi 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'di skad ces gzhan gyi tshig can dang / bdag gi tshig can dang / gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi skad kyi byings nges par gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams ni rjes su smra ba kho nar zad pas bdag gi tshig can nyid kyi brdar gdags su mi rung ngo zhes zer bas der 'dzud par byed pa dag de la mngon par
translated: They say, ‚ÄúWords are either the words of others, one‚Äôs own words, or the words of both. The nature of a verbal root that is the word of both is only a repetition. Therefore, it is not suitable to designate the word of both as a conventional symbol.‚Äù

original: zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to that,

original: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: one should say to them:

original: gzhan gyi tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag ni /
translated: ‚ÄúVerbal roots that are the words of others

original: gzhan gyi tshig can gyi ngo bo nyid dag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig can gyi ngo bo nyid dag ma yin te /
translated: are not the nature of the words of others.

original: gnyi ga'i tshig can nyid ma yin pa dang / skad kyi byings yin pa'i phyir bdag gi tshig can bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i tshig can nyid ma yin pa dang / skad kyi byings yin pa'i phyir bdag gi tshig can bzhin no //
translated: Because they are not the words of both and are verbal roots, they are like the words of oneself.‚Äù

original: bdag gi tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag la yang de skad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag la yang de skad brjod par bya'o //
translated: The verbal roots that have the meaning of ‚Äúself‚Äù should be explained in the same way.

original: de bzhin du gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag kyang gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi ngo bo nyid dag ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi skad kyi byings dag kyang gnyi ga'i tshig can gyi ngo bo nyid dag ma yin te /

original: skad kyi byings yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: skad kyi byings yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because they are verbal roots, like other verbal roots that do not have the meaning of ‚Äúboth.‚Äù

original: nges par smra ba dag la ni khyad par can gyis sbyar ba'i sgra'i rjes su smra ba'i phyir dang / sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa'i rim gyi 'gro ba dag gis tshig can nyid du 'grub pas kun rdzob tu gnod pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par smra ba dag la ni khyad par can gyis sbyar ba'i sgra'i rjes su smra ba'i phyir dang / sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa'i rim gyi 'gro ba dag gis tshig can nyid du 'grub pas kun rdzob tu gnod pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the grammarians, the verbal roots that have the meaning of ‚Äúboth‚Äù are established as having the meaning of ‚Äúboth‚Äù by the power of the convention of the grammarians, because they are the object of a statement by the grammarians, like the word ‚Äúboth.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: The grammarians, who are skilled in the rules of grammar, say that the verbal root gam, which has the meaning of ‚Äúgoing,‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúboth‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúthe goer does not go.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba po ni bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i chos ni bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba po ni bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i chos ni bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no //

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
translated: The example is established by the power of the probandum and the property of the probandum.

analyzed: de las gzhan pa yin no // 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste /

analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sdod pa po bzhin te /

original: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po mi 'gro'o //
translated: In this way, first, the goer does not go.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro bas kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do zhes zer ro //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: 'gro ba po min 'gro ba min //

analyzed: gang gi tshe tha snyad du 'gro ba dang ldan par grags pa'i 'gro ba po yang 'gro bar mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //

translated: This is

analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: Therefore, the statement of the argument is: Ultimately, the goer does not

translated: go, because of being devoid of going, like anything else.üîΩThis should beüîΩstated in the same way with respect to the views of the LokƒÅyatas and our

analyzed: gzigs zan pa'i phyogs dag dang / rang gi sde pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: own schools.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas should be challenged and analyzed with respect to their

analyzed: grangs can dag grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon nye bar 'dogs pa dag la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa de gang yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa de gang yin /

analyzed: gal te 'gro ba mi gsal ba'o zhe na ni /

analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //

translated: At that time, since it would be undermined by the inference that was taught in the context of the goer and the nongoer, the intended meaning would not be established.

analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ni mi 'gro ba kho na lo zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is ascertained that ‚Äúonly that which has activity does not go.‚Äù

original: dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni mi rtag kho na'o zhes nges par bzung bas khyab pa ma yin yang phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni mi rtag kho na'o zhes nges par bzung bas khyab pa ma yin yang phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just as it is asserted that ‚Äúonly that which is produced through exertion is impermanent‚Äù is a reason, even though it is not a pervader, it is a property of the subject.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid la yang 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid la yang 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And because going is refuted in that which has activity, the meaning of the reason is not not established.

original: 'dis 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid gtan tshigs yin par yang lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid gtan tshigs yin par yang lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This also answers the argument that ‚Äúit is devoid of going.‚Äù

original: ci ste sdod pa po ni 'gro ba po ma yin par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ste sdod pa po ni 'gro ba po ma yin par yang 'gyur la /
translated: But if the goer is not the one who is resting,

original: 'gro ba por yang 'gyur bas sdod pa po khas blangs pas dpe med de /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba chos kyi phyogs gcig dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba por yang 'gyur bas sdod pa po khas blangs pas dpe med de / bsgrub par bya ba chos kyi phyogs gcig dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and the one who is resting is not the goer, then the example is not established, because the one who is resting does not have the property of the proposition.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i cha gnyi ga la grags pas sdod pa po dper rung ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i cha gnyi ga la grags pas sdod pa po dper rung ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: But there is no error, because the one who is resting is suitable as an example, since both parts of the proposition are renowned.

original: de'i phyir gal te de lta na 'di la 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'ga' yang mi 'thad pas des na de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de lta na 'di la 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'ga' yang mi 'thad pas des na de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if it is like that, since the convention ‚Äúhe goes‚Äù is not tenable in any way, then the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the convention that possesses it exists‚Äù is not established.

original: dpe yang med de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe yang med de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no example, because the example does not have the property of the proposition.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reason is also contradictory.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes brjod pa mthong ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes brjod pa mthong ste /
translated: We see the statement ‚ÄúThe goer goes.‚Äù

original: mthong ba las ches lhag pa gzhan med pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba las ches lhag pa gzhan med pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is nothing superior to seeing, the reason and so on are not unestablished.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bden mod kyi de ni tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo gros kyis mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyi de ni tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo gros kyis mthong ba yin no //
translated: That is seen by the intelligence that belongs to conventional usage.

original: de nyid don dam par brtag par bya ste /üîΩci mthong ba de ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin nam /üîΩ'on te gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: de nyid don dam par brtag par bya ste / ci mthong ba de ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin nam / 'on te gzhan zhig yin /
translated: But that should be investigated in terms of ultimate reality.üîΩIs what is seen just as it is seen, or is it otherwise?

original: de la re zhig de bzhin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig de bzhin no zhe na ni /
translated: If it is just as it is seen,

original: shes par byar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes par byar mi nus te /
translated: then it cannot be known.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩFirst, how could it be tenable

original: re zhig 'gro'o 'gro'o zhes //üîΩji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: re zhig 'gro'o 'gro'o zhes // ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: to say ‚ÄúThe goer goes‚Äù?

original: mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te dper na g-yul ngor 'phros pa la gzhol ba ji ltar dpa' bo yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te dper na g-yul ngor 'phros pa la gzhol ba ji ltar dpa' bo yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is untenable, just as it is said, ‚ÄúHow can one who is engaged in battle be a hero?‚Äù

original: ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /
translated: How is it untenable?

original: de ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa ni /
